text: What a little gem. Phil and wathsala are delightful. They help you with tuks tuks to get to places. Breakfast in h the morning was a mixture of fruits. Eggs and little tastes of Sri lanken. Just perfect.  Swimming pool was great to dip into in the evening with the lights on.   We had three different rooms.  Mine cardoman had a lovely view over the gardens and you can hear he bread van and monkeys playing in the distance. My friend had a larger room which as a couple would be nice as it had great outdoor space.  Overall listen to what Wathsala recommends.  She knows her stuff.  Saw fin whales.  And turtles down at turtle beach. Lovely
title: Great hosts.  Great hotel.

text:
We arrived at Marissa's Spice House around 3 o'clock and were warmly welcomed by the manager, Ruwan, and his team. Ruwan gave us a tour of the property, which is even more impressive in person than in photos. The lush flora and tiered gardens are stunning, and while there are a few monkeys nearby, theyâ€™re not a bother. The lovely pool offers a perfect view of the gardens. That evening, we dined at Ruwanâ€™s recommended local restaurant, Petti Petti, where the food and service were excellent. Tuk-tuks are easily accessible for getting around. The morningâ€™s breakfast is delightful, featuring tea/coffee, fresh fruit, fruit juice, a traditional savoury, toast & condiments and even a piece of chocolate cake, making us reluctant to leave.
Thoroughly enjoyed this little gem & I highly recommended it.
title: Brilliant Gem

placeInfo: {'id': '2054131', 'name': 'The Spice House, Mirissa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 797, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.941379, 'longitude': 80.46868, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d2054131-Reviews-The_Spice_House_Mirissa-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://thespicehousemirissa.com', 'address': 'Km 151, Galle Road, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Km 151, Galle Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 10, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 19, 'count4': 82, 'count5': 680}}
text:
This place is amazing. We stayed in the Clove Cottage which was rustic but beautiful. It was very private with a balcony that looked out over the jungle. The gardens were beautiful with lots of different colours of the native plants. There were lots of monkeys, squirrels, peacocks and beautiful birds to keep us entertained. The staff were fantastic. They would always stop and speak to you to ask how you were going, what you were doing that day and if there was anything they could do for us. They were the absolute best. The breakfast was different everyday with a mixture of Western and traditional. They did the best scrambled eggs I have ever eaten. The pool was nice and warm so easy to get into and overlooked the beautiful gardens. 
The beach is just across the road and town is a 5 minute walk or a quick Tuk Tuk ride. There are plenty of places close by to eat or drink.
My only negative is the roof over the balcony keeps the breeze out and makes it a bit hotter but I understand the roof would be perfect if it was raining so it's not really a negative.
I would recommend this place in a heart beat and would like to thank all the staff for making our stay here so enjoyable. 
If we ever go back to Mirissa would never stay anywhere else.
Thank you everyone at The Spice House
title: LOVED IT

text: This is an amazing place. A hotel with bungalows in the superb gardens surrounded by jungle. We stayed for a week in one of the garden bungalows, which was great. From the seating area just outside the bungalow, the jungle is literally yards away and monkeys can be heard and seen swinging through the trees. The bungalows have one main room with a bed, aircon and a fridge, a toilet with basin, a separate shower, and one main bedroom. It was pretty rustic - the shower was cold - but climate is so hot that isn't an issue. We had breakfast with other guests, on the terrace of the house/hotel which was really good. Mirissa Beach - which was wonderful - was a short 300SLR tuktuk drive away. There are loads of restaurants on the beaches serving excellent and very reasonably priced food. A great stay.
title: A wonderful stay at the Spice House

text: A lovely property with a friendly and laid back vibe. Well equiped rooms -most with balcony and overlooking an extensive tropical garden and inviting pool. We didn't eat there but it was an option with owners/hosts providing great Sri  Lankan food. English owner Phil and his lovely wife were most helpful and gave us great dinner venues to try. They also fixed a reasonable cost driver to take us to the Wild life park and onward to Ella. All in all a faultless stay and great value for the quality provided. Vey handy to explore Mirrisa beaches, Whale watching and Wellygama beach.
title: Gem of a place to stay in Mirrisa

placeInfo: {'id': '15749075', 'name': 'Fresh Wave Mirissa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 213, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.945162, 'longitude': 80.459724, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d15749075-Reviews-Fresh_Wave_Mirissa-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': None, 'address': 'Udupila Junction, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Udupila Junction', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 11, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 26, 'count5': 160}}
text:
Nice hotel in terms of location and restaurant. The hotel is right in the beach and you can go in the sea! Breakfast was good and happy hour drinks are reasonable! 
Unfortunately though our room was very noisy in terms of the road traffic, voices on speakers, music etc. this kept us awake most of the night. There was also a strong smell of drains and there is no proper curtains meaning the room is very bright in the morning. 
Value for money on the whole is good. 
Our room was not a sea view but if you book a sea view donâ€™t expect to see the water as there are trees blocking the view.
title: Nice hotel but needs some work

placeInfo: {'id': '15749075', 'name': 'Fresh Wave Mirissa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 213, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.945162, 'longitude': 80.459724, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d15749075-Reviews-Fresh_Wave_Mirissa-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': None, 'address': 'Udupila Junction, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Udupila Junction', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 11, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 26, 'count5': 160}}
roomTip: Double check that they still have your reservation before you arrive and they havenâ€™t given your room to someone else.
text:
Unfortunately our experience with Fresh Wave left much to be desired. When we arrived to check in the receptionist asked if we had received her message on booking.com. We had not received it, and on checking the messages at 11:30am the morning of check-in she had tried to send us a message informing us they could not give us our confirmed room we had reserved. The reason? They had given it to someone else the day before. So they had no room to give us for our reservation. They expected us to just be ok with this, we were not as we now had no where to stay. After some conversation they tried to find us alternative accommodation. The first place they took us to was a right next door but the rooms were not nice. Another one only had availability for one night (we needed 2), and another one was not near the beach (the reason we had RESERVED this hotel). After about half an hour of getting nowhere they finally offered us a room with a more expensive nightly rates for our original room rate but they only had it available for one night. This was a nice concession and we took it as the kids were getting restless and we just wanted to put our bags somewhere. Once in the room we managed on our own to find another place to book for our second night.

The only person who I will say was amazing was Lesenke (sp?) who went out of his way showing my husband to the other hotel options, setting up the room they finally gave us, getting us an extra mattress, and providing us with the wifi.

Unfortunately the whole experience left a bad taste in our mouths and ruined our first day in Mirissa. The hotel itself is in a great location, the beach is beautiful, breakfast was delicious, and the room we were in was spacious, bright, and comfortable (although a lot of ants). Itâ€™s just too bad they donâ€™t honour their reservations. So just a warning to others.
title: Nice hotel, unfortunately have our room away leaving us stranded

roomTip: Really loud beach music you wonâ€™t get any sleep if thereâ€™s a beach party going on, itâ€™s thumping shaking all of the windows in the room
text:
Iâ€™m laying here at 11:44pm with music thumping so loud itâ€™s shaking the windows. Read the other bad reviews before you book, theyâ€™re mostly correct.
Iâ€™m really not one to ever bother reviewing as Iâ€™m conscious of not driving business away from anywhere which may be having an off day but this place sucks.
The music from the beach parties is SO loud, a continuous thump that even with ear plugs I canâ€™t sleep. Itâ€™s like torture, keeping me awake.
The food isnâ€™t good, meat kept in bay-maries that arenâ€™t even hot. There arenâ€™t many options in the buffet, I really expected more from the pictures.
Itâ€™s just not worth it, book a hotel away from the beach or better yet avoid mirissa all together, especially in the shoulder or off season when the weather isnâ€™t great. Thereâ€™s nothing to do other than roam a few dirty shops. Itâ€™s not the â€˜coolâ€™ travel destination I was hoping to experience at all. Not worth the cost.
title: Go elsewhere

Breakfast was excellent. Unfortunately our family was spilt in two rooms and they were located quite far apart.

Most of the outdoor sun lounges were either completely broken or in very poor condition. The resort allows people from outside the resort to hire sun lounges and swim in the pool so itâ€™s a bit of a free for all.
Didnâ€™t feel my property was secure. It felt like a backpackers resort at a premium price. On the plus side itâ€™s right on the beach.
title: NOT WHAT WE THOUGHT WE HAD PAID FOR

Was lovely to walk down the beach in the evening passing the many bars and restaurants nearby - although the food is great in the hotel itself. Lots to do in the area so ideal not only for sun worshippers but those interested in all the various seas sports and whale watching options etc

text:
Rooms are good enough for what I paid but a little tired and I worried over the safety of my belongings here . The position is amazing and I was happy enough with the service although found one waiter in the restaurant a little rude to be honest ! Some customer service skills would be good ! I only had a dinner here and breakfast and it was fine for what I paid . For a stunning  location with a bit more investment they could charge a lot more and be the best in town ! The towels are so old they need replacing and but best bathroom products Iâ€™ve used all holiday , All in all 
Not a bad stay for the money at times a little noisey with banging doors which isnâ€™t their fault to be fair ! Iâ€™d give a 3/5
title: Stunning location

Gunasiri Mahimi Mawatha', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 88, 'count2': 103, 'count3': 201, 'count4': 443, 'count5': 220}}
roomTip:
Avoid the food! 
The staff here are the only people in Sri Lanka who are rude and unhelpful.
text:
NOTE: we were only day guests here.

The location of this hotel is stunning, the beach and pool area is beautiful, plenty of space for everyone and it is cleaned regularly. 

However, the staff are ignorant and lazy, could not care less about customers. No one offers drinks/food and we had to ask 4 times to get chips cleaned off a table and off the floor from previous customers (this took 20mins). We also saw the manager take empty bottles from our table and put it on another table for one of his staff to sort later. We witnessed a waiter clear a table and put all the dishes on our table whilst we were in the pool and then were surprised when we told them to remove it. The food is not good, hot or worth the money either when there are some fab places to eat on the beach.
title: Service is diabolical

placeInfo: {'id': '1902973', 'name': 'Palm Villa Mirissa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 762, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.94277, 'longitude': 80.463036, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d1902973-Reviews-Palm_Villa_Mirissa-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://palmvillamirissa.wixsite.com/palmvillamirissa', 'address': 'Matara Road Bandaramulla, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Matara Road', 'street2': 'Bandaramulla', 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 39, 'count4': 199, 'count5': 499}}
text:
Genuinely surprised by the positive reviews for palm villa, so much so I wonder if they are fake, which of course is not possible. 

We booked for 5 nights based on these reviews but I was so disappointed when we arrived, we tried to find alternative accommodation but couldnâ€™t find anything else so had to stay.

The location is absolutely 5 stars, it has great views and it is at the quieter end of the beach which we appreciated. The staff are also very pleasant and friendly and we had nice breakfasts looking at the sea each morning. 

The property however, is full of damp, infested with ants, mosquitoes and cockroaches.  To call this a boutique spa which I have seen on other platforms is completely misleading and is quite upsetting to feel you are being so mislead after travelling from very far and spending so much money. 

Our room was on the 1st floor, it was unclean and is in desperate need of investment and renovation.  I wonder if the positive reviews are based on the other building, as they are worlds away from the building we were in.

Whilst we were there our neighbours also shared the same experience and we saw staff taking bug killer and disinfectants to various rooms. 

I am a seasoned traveller and have stayed in many budget accommodations so expected simple rooms with basic amenities but I have never stayed anywhere like this, in fact I think it is grossly overpriced for the standard.

I would not stay here again or recommend anyone to stay here.
title: Damp, dirty and infested with insectsâ€¦but a great view

placeInfo: {'id': '1902973', 'name': 'Palm Villa Mirissa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 762, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.94277, 'longitude': 80.463036, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d1902973-Reviews-Palm_Villa_Mirissa-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://palmvillamirissa.wixsite.com/palmvillamirissa', 'address': 'Matara Road Bandaramulla, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Matara Road', 'street2': 'Bandaramulla', 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 39, 'count4': 199, 'count5': 499}}
roomTip:
Air con units are very noisy
Check bathroom for ants
Bring mosquito repellant
text:
Palm villa has some good reviews which I am confused about and found them not to be a true reflection of our five night stay.

So for a bit more accurate information for people to manage your expectations are below.

Letâ€™s start with the good

The location is great

Breakfast with a lovely view

Lovely staff especially Sochi the manager

The bad

The rooms are infested with insects ants, mosquitos and cockroaches

There is damp and mold everywhere

The air con units are so loud itâ€™s hard to relax on the balcony

Palm villa is very expensive for what is provided .

The whole place needs renovating and is dirty

The owner / agent Maria is very rude and arrogant. 

We didn't complain when we arrived but asked her to look at the air con unit next door as it was horribly loud. 

Aggressively she came round banging on our door and was very rude. We didn't want to speak to her again so just put up with it.

I would suggest she should learn some customer service skills as it wasn't very nice
title: Bug Infested room / arrogant and rude agent!!!

placeInfo: {'id': '1902973', 'name': 'Palm Villa Mirissa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 762, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.94277, 'longitude': 80.463036, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d1902973-Reviews-Palm_Villa_Mirissa-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://palmvillamirissa.wixsite.com/palmvillamirissa', 'address': 'Matara Road Bandaramulla, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Matara Road', 'street2': 'Bandaramulla', 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 16, 'count3': 39, 'count4': 199, 'count5': 499}}
roomTip: You must have that local Sri Lankan curry !! Cannot recommend highly enough.
text:
Loved it !!! A 250 year - old former family home right on the beachfront. 

First of all the staff. A very pleasant Sachi, Ruchika, Indika, Aloka and Hiransa delivered excellent, unobtrusive service and always with a smile. The room was clean and comfortable with A/C. Breakfast was included, complete with a front - row seat to see the surfers and you haven't lived until you've had the local curry for dinner!!

The location itself is quiet, just off the centre of the beachfront, with peaceful gardens to sunbathe or to relax with a book. The gentle sea breeze provides the air conditioning. Other amenities are within a 10 minute walk away including a supermarket and laundry. We checked out most of the other hotels in Mirissa and this one wins hands - down.
title: Read this!!

placeInfo: {'id': '1307887', 'name': 'Mandara Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 874, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.964277, 'longitude': 80.45385, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d1307887-Reviews-Mandara_Resort-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.mandarahotels.com/mandararesortmirissa/', 'address': '416 A, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '416 A', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 75, 'count2': 63, 'count3': 150, 'count4': 223, 'count5': 364}}
roomTip: Avoid if you can
text:
We had an unfortunate stay at Mandara, mostly due to ongoing construction noise and being lied to by all levels of management staff. The first room we were brought to, was refused,  due to the poor size and facilities, not being like the advertised pictures, the second room was slightly better, but is in need of some maintenance and has mold everywhere. We were nearing the end of a fabulous 3 week stay in Sri Lanka, and this hotel was the worst of all the places we stayed. If we had been told the truth about construction noise next door to our unit, we would have changed hotels like other families did staying at the same time. Instead, we were promised many things, lied to about when the noise would stop, and management tried to placate with free drinks, trips into town etc etc.
Mold on walls, no hot water on second day, and had to ask multiple times and multiple front desk staff for attention/ cleaning etc. Beach is dirty with trash bags on beach.  Spoken to by General Manager who goes by Leon, and as he is friendly with our travel agent, offered free accommodation for when we return to Mirissa. We would not stay here again...ever.
title: Stay Away

placeInfo: {'id': '1307887', 'name': 'Mandara Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 874, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.964277, 'longitude': 80.45385, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d1307887-Reviews-Mandara_Resort-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.mandarahotels.com/mandararesortmirissa/', 'address': '416 A, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '416 A', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 75, 'count2': 63, 'count3': 150, 'count4': 223, 'count5': 364}}
text:
Worst experience ever! Unprofessional staff with the horrible customer service and standards . Not clean enough too . 
The rooms were so basic though it was large in size . There was a construction going on from early morning continuously  while the guests are residing which was soo disappointing and they stop whenever we complain only . We were upgraded to a different room and there was no water in the washroom plus the plunge pool area was very dirty . I think no one has gone to that area for a while as no one has cleaned the shower cubicle either . No standards in this hotel at all even the restaurant. Food was not good either , pancakes looked like hoppers and the plates and glasses were dirty .

Truly not worth the price we paid . We had a very bad experience and we will never recommend this property to anyone !
title: Highly disappointed!

text:
The stay and service was lovely. We had a great time at Mandara.

Ajantha -  pastries chef : was proactive and supportive towards the last minute cake orders for birthday and anniversary. 
In spite of being busy with loads of orders for those 2 days.
Always with a smile and warmth.
Stay blessed always 
Rock it Ajantha !!

PS: The reception must be more prompt with answering calls and reverting.

placeInfo: {'id': '1307887', 'name': 'Mandara Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 874, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.964277, 'longitude': 80.45385, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d1307887-Reviews-Mandara_Resort-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.mandarahotels.com/mandararesortmirissa/', 'address': '416 A, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '416 A', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 75, 'count2': 63, 'count3': 150, 'count4': 223, 'count5': 364}}
roomTip: beach front rooms are best.
text: Spent a very relaxing week at Mandara resort after travelling by bus through Sri Lanka. Room was comfortable with a view of the ocean, staff very helpful and friendly, and wonderful food, under the expert supervision of head chef Ajanta. A good place to unwind and be well looked after. Alan.
title: A beautiful location with very friendly staff.

placeInfo: {'id': '1307887', 'name': 'Mandara Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 874, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.964277, 'longitude': 80.45385, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d1307887-Reviews-Mandara_Resort-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.mandarahotels.com/mandararesortmirissa/', 'address': '416 A, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '416 A', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 75, 'count2': 63, 'count3': 150, 'count4': 223, 'count5': 364}}
roomTip: Safe for solo female travellers
text:
Recently I stayed at Mandara for 7 nights while Iearning surfing at Weligama and Mirissa. To my surprise , beach access was no where mentioned in the description but hotel has direct access to the beach. You can spend evening either fishing near the lagoon area with locals or enjoy the beauty of the majestic ocean and sun.
The staffs and the management are super hospitable and flexible with everything. Management do understand and is considerate of all the scenarios and personal taste and are flexible enough to provide any room upgrade and change even after check-in. Mr. Ashain and Mr. Padam Shri were always available to attend any such issues 24Ã—7.
Restaurant has got amazing food both local and continental.  Chefs prepare some of the best local cuisines. The sambols and Pastry items prepared by Mr. Ajant are must try. You can reach out to Nimesh at the restaurant for customization at per your taste bud.

Experienced local music too during dinner. Resort has soo much to offer but little mentioned on the website.

Stay is very safe for solo female travellers. And equally enjoyable for family and couples.
title: Serene Stay and Beautiful Beach View

placeInfo: {'id': '1307887', 'name': 'Mandara Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 874, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.964277, 'longitude': 80.45385, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d1307887-Reviews-Mandara_Resort-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.mandarahotels.com/mandararesortmirissa/', 'address': '416 A, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '416 A', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 75, 'count2': 63, 'count3': 150, 'count4': 223, 'count5': 364}}
roomTip: Try to avoid.
text:
We had a three night stay at Mandara Hotel, Mirissa. Our expectations were high after going through social media and seeing the photos. On arrival, no one welcomed us. Our driver had to carry our luggage to the lobby area. Got a free room with sea view. #97  just above the gym. The room was specious but had broken luggage rack and issues with water pressure. We didn't mind it. After using the gym,  tried to take a shower but no hot water. informed the front office and the young gentleman told he will inform the maintenance. Half an hour later, since nothing happened went to reception to check. The same gentleman told they can't do anything. So I requested a room change. The receptionist told they are full and don't have any rooms available for a room change. Since we booked the room via Agoda, checked the Agoda website and to my surprise there were enough rooms to book. So I booked a room for euro 88 for one night and showed the receptionist  to give a room since I have made an extra booking. Then, a few of the management staff got involved and offered a room change. Saying they are not full and have enough rooms to move. The next day, the general manager requested us to come to his office to talk about the situation. Wonder why he didn't come to us instead.  Felt like going to the principals office all over again. After talking to GM, Mr. Liyanage  assured that a refund would be authorised to Agoda. As promised he authorised a refund for one night but the authorization was not for the euro 88 booking which I did for the night but the first night out of the tree nights block booking which was euro 65.
We feel like we were ripped off  for a hotel, which is not up to standards. Bed sheets were patched, bathroom fittings were loose, and television fittings were hanging. Staff not trained or not interested but i must say, except few hard working staff members. Kishan from the restaurant who is a hardworking person and Anupama the executive house keeper. Who had just started but tried to do everything to make our stay a good one. According to GM one of our booking came to another ota, so they couldn't refund the room night, which was booked for euro 88 but the cheaper night.
title: Mandara, upgrade your property and staff.

This hotel is a hidden gem!

Good location, net and clean property. Helpful staff and good food, one of the best hotel in Srilank we have stayed.

placeInfo: {'id': '1307887', 'name': 'Mandara Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 874, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.964277, 'longitude': 80.45385, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d1307887-Reviews-Mandara_Resort-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.mandarahotels.com/mandararesortmirissa/', 'address': '416 A, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '416 A', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 75, 'count2': 63, 'count3': 150, 'count4': 223, 'count5': 364}}
text:
If you want enjoy Mirissa/Weligama beaches whilst having a peaceful stay without hundreds of surfers and beach goers around you, this is the place.
This was exactly what me & my wife was looking for when we went on our honeymoon and we had a really good experience at Mandara.
Room was spacious and clean with a wonderful view of the beach. Each room has its own private balcony or veranda where you can sit and enjoy the view of the ocean with hardly any disturbances.
Service was excellent. From the point I called Mr Liyanage for the booking till I checked out, each and every person went out of their way to make our stay a pleasant one. The gentleman at the restaurant named Arthur ( I think thats his name) always had our favorite spot reserved and prepared for us without us even requesting for it. The pool attendant also was exceptionally helpful.
Location is really nice with the ocean in the front and the Polwatta river on the side. Also during our stay we managed to visit Mathara fort, Secret Beach, Coconut Tree Hill & Hakgedi Ella waterfall all within half an hours drive from the hotel.
Overall our stay was extremely pleasant and if I am to point one are they can look to improve, that would be to change the menu from one day to another. When you are staying for a longer period than a day, the same menu gets a lil monotonous.
title: The place where you can Enjoy Weligama/Mirissa whilst in a peaceful quiet setting...

text:
Recently visited Mandara Resort Mirissa and as an overall it was a nice experience. The atmosphere was calm and quiet and exactly what is needed for a relaxing getaway. Nestled in a beautiful location, the place is gifted with the Weligama bay and also a lagoon area. One of the highlights of my stay was the charming swing set right in front of the sea, perfect for enjoying the view despite the rough tides.  
The hotel staff were friendly and gave an excellent service throughout the stay. A special mention goes to Mr.Collin ,the manager, who ensured that all our needs were met. The rooms were comfortable, clean and nice.
I would recommend this hotel for anyone seeking a peaceful retreat in a picturesque setting.
title: A peaceful stay

placeInfo: {'id': '1307887', 'name': 'Mandara Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 874, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.964277, 'longitude': 80.45385, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d1307887-Reviews-Mandara_Resort-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.mandarahotels.com/mandararesortmirissa/', 'address': '416 A, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '416 A', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 75, 'count2': 63, 'count3': 150, 'count4': 223, 'count5': 364}}
text:
We had an amazing stay at Mandara Resort for 3 days in March. We stayed in a Sea view Room and had a great time. The Room was spacious with a Balcony overlooking beautiful Mirissa Beach. Staff was very polite, friendly and Courteous.
 Every query or request was handled efficiently by new Front Office Supervisor "Himasha" who will go above and beyond to deliver great Customer Service.
 The location, view, Pool and the Beach were impressive. The Garden Dinner Buffets and the live Music were quite Good as well. The "Calypso Band" would entertain you with your own song requests. Do not forget to get a massage if you stay in this beautiful Resort by, friendly Lady Therapist "Shanthi" and to have a swim in the lovely Pool and having a chat with very friendly Pool Boy "Sampath". We were so impressed with Himasha, Shanthi and Sampath I gave the feedback to the Group General Manager upon checking out. We will certainly stay in this Resort with our next visit to Sri Lanka. Some of our Australian Friends have already stayed in this Resort with the great feedback we have given after our Tour.
title: Family, Friendly, Scenic Luxury

text: This is a pretty nice place to stay, in Mirissa, Sri Lanka.  Staff are friendly.  Food in the restaurant tasted great, they pay attention when you say you don't want mayo or sauce on your food and the portion size was huge.  The buffet breakfast has bacon and fruit along with a heap of other things I just mention those as some other places in Sri Lanka don't include those things. Staff are all friendly and go out of their way to help you. I stayed in the non main building and the room I had was excellent.  Spacious, comfortable bed, housekeeping did an awesome job, it was quiet, shower is big and has hot water. Wi-fi was good although it did sometimes slow down late at night. Other guests asked for a router which the hotel provides but that wasn't really that big a deal to me.

roomTip: Good Location/recommend place/friendly staff
text:
we had stayed in month of April with my family in mandara resort in mirissa.it was a lovely stay with great location & great service.we enjoy the fish curry with milk rice from the buffet etc. special thanks to the chef who made the food delighted.The reception staff/Housekeeping/room service/life guard sampath were very helpful.when we were in the pool lifeguard sampath is without getting delay he was placing beach bed with Matt. me & my wife were enjoying the beach.the room which we had were very beautiful with great location.Special thank to Mr.Liyanage & Shyamini from reservations.they were very helpful.
Once a again i would like to thank you guys for the great hospitality.
we will recommend your property & hope to see you soon.

Thank you
Best regards
Tinesh Cooray
title: feedback

placeInfo: {'id': '7608347', 'name': 'Randiya Sea View Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 322, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.944735, 'longitude': 80.46083, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d7608347-Reviews-Randiya_Sea_View_Hotel-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.randiya.lk', 'address': 'Matara Road Udupila Road, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Matara Road', 'street2': 'Udupila Road', 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 13, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 25, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 196}}
text: This was one of my favorite hotels during my holiday in Sri Lanka. I was here for 8 days. My room was huge and with a double bed, refrigeriator and lots of space. The bathroom was Nice and clean, and the terrasse was Big with a side view to Mirissa beach and the pool at the hotel. I really enjoyed my stay here, and for sure I am coming back to visit in spring next year. The staff was sooo sweet, always smiling and always ready to help me no matter what my request was regarding. All in all, a great experience
title: Wonderfull hotel and kind people

placeInfo: {'id': '7608347', 'name': 'Randiya Sea View Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 322, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.944735, 'longitude': 80.46083, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d7608347-Reviews-Randiya_Sea_View_Hotel-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.randiya.lk', 'address': 'Matara Road Udupila Road, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Matara Road', 'street2': 'Udupila Road', 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 13, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 25, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 196}}
text: I had an incredible experience staying at Randiya Hotel in Mirissa. The beachfront location is perfect, offering stunning ocean views and a peaceful atmosphere. The staff were exceptional â€“ always friendly, attentive, and ready to help with anything we needed. A special mention to the manager, Sanjeewa, who went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. He is truly a great manager and a wonderful person. The hotel itself is clean, well-maintained, and offers all the amenities you could need for a relaxing stay. I highly recommend Randiya Hotel for anyone visiting Mirissa!
title: Amazing Beachfront Stay at Randiya Hotel!

placeInfo: {'id': '7608347', 'name': 'Randiya Sea View Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 322, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.944735, 'longitude': 80.46083, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d7608347-Reviews-Randiya_Sea_View_Hotel-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.randiya.lk', 'address': 'Matara Road Udupila Road, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Matara Road', 'street2': 'Udupila Road', 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 13, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 25, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 196}}
text: A nice stay in Mirissa located right across the street from the beach. Hotel is within walking distance of many shops and restaurants. WiFi was good and room was quite spacious. Room was very clean. Very nice pool on the ground floor. Food at restaurant was really good. It was a bit awkward as the staff all stood around us starring at us while we ate. Overall a great stay.

placeInfo: {'id': '7608347', 'name': 'Randiya Sea View Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 322, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.944735, 'longitude': 80.46083, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d7608347-Reviews-Randiya_Sea_View_Hotel-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.randiya.lk', 'address': 'Matara Road Udupila Road, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Matara Road', 'street2': 'Udupila Road', 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 13, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 25, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 196}}
roomTip: Please don't waste your money. Not worth it.
text:
This is the WORST hotel we have visited in our 20 days trip to SriLanka. Not worth it for the price payed. This hotel should be rated 0 zero NOT 4.3.
We have visited many countries never seen a rude receptionist (both) like in this hotel. Very bad customer service. 
I am now reading some of the previous reviews where other customers have experienced the same. I hope after reading this review hotel management take proper action and train their staffs. 
We will NEVER come back to this place again. 
Before booking we saw the rating 4.3 and believed this will be great hotel. ALL FAKE. I cant believe someone rated 5 this hotel I would rate 0. 
Starting from the hallway its either broken or not cleaned. Washroom shower with mold and smell. Shower handle does not work properly. 
Shower sliding door need two people to hold and close. Balcony railings are broken, didn't let my children out for safety. 
For the wifi you need to call everytime as the password keeps on changing. Through out our stay in this hotel all I did was keep calling the reception for washroom tissue, 
water bottle, wifi  password, etc. We wasted our two days in this hotel. Most of the time NO response or they will say "Will call you back" and never did. 
One point we complained re their service and this is the exact response of the receptionist "We are like this you can find another place if you don't like here". 
After this some staffs are staring at us, we didn't feel safe in this hotel. 
PLEASE DO NOT VISIT THIS HOTEL. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE and DONT FEEL SAFE HERE. This is not the experience we want from SriLanka. DO NOT BOOK this hotel. First their service is really bad. 
Never seen a receptionist very rude and attitude and talking to their guest so bad-mannered
We booked halfboard and their dinner menu has only one item nothing else, and that's a pasta with Chicken. I am coming from aboard where I eat that every day 
I don't need to spend money to come Srilanka to eat pasta.
When we requested for Srilankan food they said we have to pay additional. We spoke to the receptionist and said that we didn't have any issue with other places we stayed why your dinner menu is not good. Her response was "this is what we provide for our set menu".
This is our 7th hotel in Srilanka and we didnt experience anything like this in any of the other 6 hotels. 
If you walk 5 min from the hotel you can get good food for reasonable price. Why I have to pay for the halfboard and additional again. Worse experience. 
VERY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE - WILL NOT RECOMMEND
title: VERY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE - WILL NOT RECOMMEND

placeInfo: {'id': '7608347', 'name': 'Randiya Sea View Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 322, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.944735, 'longitude': 80.46083, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d7608347-Reviews-Randiya_Sea_View_Hotel-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.randiya.lk', 'address': 'Matara Road Udupila Road, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Matara Road', 'street2': 'Udupila Road', 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 13, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 25, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 196}}
text: If you are a Srilankan living abroad please DO NOT VISIT THIS HOTEL. No respect for the people speaking in native languages. Staffs are not friendly very rude. Especially the receptionist, she needs to attend training on customer service and how to speak with guests. No client satisfaction very poor service. For four people they only kept two water bottles and for three days stay no refill on coffee or tea bags. We didn't experience this in other hotels in Srilanka. I would rate 0 to this hotel. Never come back to this place again. Very bad experience.
title: Terrible Customer Service

placeInfo: {'id': '7608347', 'name': 'Randiya Sea View Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 322, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.944735, 'longitude': 80.46083, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d7608347-Reviews-Randiya_Sea_View_Hotel-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.randiya.lk', 'address': 'Matara Road Udupila Road, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Matara Road', 'street2': 'Udupila Road', 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 13, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 25, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 196}}

text: Great hotel with a very nice location. Has all the facilities available and the staffâ€™s super kind. (The beds are superrr comfy) The rooms are clean and the view is perfect from the balcony! The breakfastâ€™s pretty decent too. Highly recommended for a good beach view.

placeInfo: {'id': '7608347', 'name': 'Randiya Sea View Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 322, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.944735, 'longitude': 80.46083, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d7608347-Reviews-Randiya_Sea_View_Hotel-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.randiya.lk', 'address': 'Matara Road Udupila Road, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Matara Road', 'street2': 'Udupila Road', 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 13, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 25, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 196}}
text: One of the best hotels in Mirissa. They had great rooms with all the facilities. The hotel was right opposite to the entrance of the beach and it was very convenient. Above all, they have one of the best staffs. Most polite and humble people on could come across. They specially packed breakfast for us at 5:30 in the morning because we were leaving for whale watching. They even ask what you want to have for breakfast and consider your requests. You would be surprised how good the staff is there. This was what stood out and made our experience memorable.
title: Best stay in Mirissa

placeInfo: {'id': '7608347', 'name': 'Randiya Sea View Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 322, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.944735, 'longitude': 80.46083, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d7608347-Reviews-Randiya_Sea_View_Hotel-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.randiya.lk', 'address': 'Matara Road Udupila Road, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Matara Road', 'street2': 'Udupila Road', 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 13, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 25, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 196}}
text:
Its a decent looking hotel on the main beach road in the middle of Marissa with easy access to the beach on the other side of the road, the pool is good and the staff were pleasant.
To enter the hotel you have to make your way around several vehicles/ Buses that are parked right in front of reception and the pool, therefore while swimming or relaxing on the sunbeds your looking at buses, even worse the shower that you are supposed to use before entering the pool is on the other side of those vehicles, tucked away by the outside wall across what is a carpark.
 Our room was a good size and had a great view of the pool and beach but the woodwork on the balcony was rotting and dangerous. It was not that clean, the bathroom and entrance area had ants everywhere, we had to ask to have our room cleaned because it wasn't done the first day. The corridor as you leave the lifts has the air-conditioning units for each room hung along the walls and is boiling and smelly. I wouldn't stay again.
title: Looks good, but !

placeInfo: {'id': '7608347', 'name': 'Randiya Sea View Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 322, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.944735, 'longitude': 80.46083, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d7608347-Reviews-Randiya_Sea_View_Hotel-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.randiya.lk', 'address': 'Matara Road Udupila Road, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Matara Road', 'street2': 'Udupila Road', 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 13, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 25, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 196}}
text:
This is a conveniently located decent hotel with all necessary amenities and also a very friendly and a supportive staff. They are very responsive and always there in case we need their assisting.
5 minute drive to Mirissa fisheries harbor from here, where all whale and dolphin watching tours starts.
Food were of great taste and served nice. Rooms has good facilities but there could be more improvements and proper maintenance. We observed some damages in furniture and think it would be better to have square plug sockets in all power outlets as almost all new electronics comes with square plug tops for charging. Clean service could be a little improved. 

The main problem here is the parking. There's no separate parking space. Taking vehicles in and out is hard when there are many guests and when their vehicles are parked right outside and in front of the reception lobby and swimming pool. 

Overall, it is a very good place to stay during your trip to Mirissa and hope they will continue with their best and work on improvements that could make a big difference.
title: Good Location, Friendly Staff, Great Food, Beach Front, Best in Mirissa for Whale and Dolphin Watching

placeInfo: {'id': '7608347', 'name': 'Randiya Sea View Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 322, 'locationString': 'Mirissa, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.944735, 'longitude': 80.46083, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1407334-d7608347-Reviews-Randiya_Sea_View_Hotel-Mirissa_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.randiya.lk', 'address': 'Matara Road Udupila Road, Mirissa 81740 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Matara Road', 'street2': 'Udupila Road', 'city': 'Mirissa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81740'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 13, 'count2': 21, 'count3': 25, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 196}}

roomTip: Ask for a upper floor see view room
text:
The hotel room offers ample space, and the Front Desk staff is exceptionally friendly and well-trained in customer service. The pool is meticulously maintained, although it would be beneficial to have changing rooms in close proximity to the pool area. Overall, the experience is highly commendable and justifies the expenditure.

However, my only unfavorable encounter was with the Security Officer. It is recommended to provide thorough training to security personnel on effective communication with guests. The manner in which he spoke gave the impression that our stay was obligatory, and a more customer-friendly approach would greatly enhance the overall guest experience.

placeInfo: {'id': '10052141', 'name': 'Jkab Beach Resort', 'rating': 3.5, 'numberOfReviews': 211, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.596079, 'longitude': 81.22259, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d10052141-Reviews-Jkab_Beach_Resort-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jkabbeachresort.com', 'address': '686/11 North Coast Road Uppuveli, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '686/11 North Coast Road', 'street2': 'Uppuveli', 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '31000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 34, 'count2': 20, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 53}}
roomTip: Avoid it
text:
I strongly advise against staying at this hotel. The condition of the room is not consistent with the one presented on the Booking portal. The room is dirty, old and unkept. The equipment is very worn, the shower head leaks onto the electric water heater, there is mold on the walls. We did not receive towels or bath accessories, we had to ask for them. In conclusion, the condition of the rooms is not consistent with the condition offered, at the same time posing a danger to users (dirt, mold). The pool is also destroyed, cracked tiles. Additionally, during 6 of our nights, the facility organized very loud parties until the night hours. Breakfasts are monotonous, of average quality.
I do not recommend, using the services of this facility will ruin your vacation.
title: The worst hotel I have ever been

placeInfo: {'id': '10052141', 'name': 'Jkab Beach Resort', 'rating': 3.5, 'numberOfReviews': 211, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.596079, 'longitude': 81.22259, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d10052141-Reviews-Jkab_Beach_Resort-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jkabbeachresort.com', 'address': '686/11 North Coast Road Uppuveli, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '686/11 North Coast Road', 'street2': 'Uppuveli', 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '31000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 34, 'count2': 20, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 53}}

placeInfo: {'id': '10052141', 'name': 'Jkab Beach Resort', 'rating': 3.5, 'numberOfReviews': 211, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.596079, 'longitude': 81.22259, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d10052141-Reviews-Jkab_Beach_Resort-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jkabbeachresort.com', 'address': '686/11 North Coast Road Uppuveli, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '686/11 North Coast Road', 'street2': 'Uppuveli', 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '31000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 34, 'count2': 20, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 53}}
text: We stayed two nights in this hotel. The hotel located in a nice location and the staffs are nice but the rooms and washrooms are not cleaned properly. Spider webs in the room. Washroom had old broken faucets and the shower curtain must be older than 5 years and looks like never changed. Washroom floor and side tiles had mold and bad smell came on the second day of our stay. Dinner was not good. Their menu combination is really bad. They need to do a better job in their menu.

placeInfo: {'id': '10052141', 'name': 'Jkab Beach Resort', 'rating': 3.5, 'numberOfReviews': 211, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.596079, 'longitude': 81.22259, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d10052141-Reviews-Jkab_Beach_Resort-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jkabbeachresort.com', 'address': '686/11 North Coast Road Uppuveli, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '686/11 North Coast Road', 'street2': 'Uppuveli', 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '31000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 34, 'count2': 20, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 53}}
text:
The term â€œLooks are descriptive â€œ is just right for this hotel. We looked at the cabana photos and were happy. They looked picture perfect, literally.  We get there and the first thing I observe is that they are NOT beach fronted. We open the door to our cabana and a hit blast hit us! Air conditioning took its time to work. Nothing â€œdeluxeâ€ about it. Itâ€™s so compact my husband and I couldnâ€™t pass each other without falling over. The only good thing about the cabana was the bed. It was comfortable. Donâ€™t even want to say anything about the bathroom. I was so glad we did a lot of sight seeing and went to the hotel only for dinner and sleep. 

My friends who opted for rooms told me the rooms were good. I didnâ€™t visit the rooms so cannot say for sure. 

Jimmy and his crew at the restaurant were a different story. Breakfast and dinner were quite good. And the service was fine. Perhaps the only redeeming feature about the hotel. 

Superb view no doubt of the endless sea and we watched two beautiful sunrises, thanks to Mother Nature. 

Will I go there again? Will I recommend it? No to both. Unless and until the owners practice what they preach.
title: JKAB RESORT TRINCO

placeInfo: {'id': '10052141', 'name': 'Jkab Beach Resort', 'rating': 3.5, 'numberOfReviews': 211, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.596079, 'longitude': 81.22259, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d10052141-Reviews-Jkab_Beach_Resort-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jkabbeachresort.com', 'address': '686/11 North Coast Road Uppuveli, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '686/11 North Coast Road', 'street2': 'Uppuveli', 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '31000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 34, 'count2': 20, 'count3': 37, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 53}}

placeInfo: {'id': '7079606', 'name': 'Anantamaa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 393, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.615138, 'longitude': 81.21772, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d7079606-Reviews-Anantamaa-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.anantamaa.com', 'address': 'No 0742, Alles Garden, Trincomalee Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No 0742, Alles Garden', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 16, 'count2': 20, 'count3': 47, 'count4': 127, 'count5': 183}}
text:
This is a badly managed hotel, in a very poor location near a beach which is dirty and unsafe. Not recommended . For sea bathing much better to head north to Nilaveli beach or South to Pasikudah. 

This hotel is not on the beach, but one block in -  you have to go down a small path to get to the beach. And the beach there is dirty, and the sea is rough and murky. Nilaveli beach a few miles away is much cleaner and safer. 

The food at the hotel is poor. But worse is that the management allow outsiders to have parties. One afternoon a crowd of about 30 men came with arrack and drank until they were drunk . By 6 pm they were all in the pool with their clothes on. And the noise. So we couldnâ€™t swim at all. Unacceptable.
title: Avoid this hotel !

placeInfo: {'id': '7079606', 'name': 'Anantamaa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 393, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.615138, 'longitude': 81.21772, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d7079606-Reviews-Anantamaa-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.anantamaa.com', 'address': 'No 0742, Alles Garden, Trincomalee Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No 0742, Alles Garden', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 16, 'count2': 20, 'count3': 47, 'count4': 127, 'count5': 183}}
text:
OK, the positives. Friendly staff, though several on the Reception appeared to be standing around with little to do.  We had an issue with our AirCon not working, which was a bit of an inconvenience as we had to swop rooms, but the maintenance team did sort it out overtnight. The garden is landscaped around several mature trees and the large pool, which has plenty of loungers, showers and a bar. 
The shower in our room was excellent - good power and heat. Beds hard, but very comfortable. We stayed 4 nights and the room was cleaned daily. Rooms have seating outside.  
Good access to the beach via a private path and several places to have a drink or some food are close by. The nearest, YOUR CHOICE, plays loud music all day so not exactly relaxing if you are using the Anantamaa beach loungers, but at night you can sit nearer the surf on the beach, which softens the noise. The next place down the beach (towards Trincomalee), THE 18th HOLE, had a fun, younger vibe with different stalls offering everything from sushi to burgers, pizza to tacos. Sushi was excellent. A little further down the beach was WAVES restaurant, which did some great fish/seafood, but choice of fish was limited. 
Negatives: The hotel just looks a little tired and really needs updating.  A little more attention to some details and some investment would go a long way. 
Our room was basic - some fitted wardrobes, but only a handful of hangers. No bedside lamp and little decoration on the walls. Felt a bit soulless, but it was clean. 
Breakfast was typical fare, but really  basic and not particularly appetising. Dry pastries and dreadful coffee. 4 days and the same options every day.  It was no big surprise to see that the restaurant was almost empty every night we were there - guests were obviously choosing to dine elsewhere.
The fish ponds surrounding the pool area are green and smelt stagnant - they were so murky, you can only just see the fish swimming in them. Some oxygen and a regular clean is necessary.  The pool area is great, but the bar staff play music for much of the day, the choice of which seems more for their benefit than the guests.  Looking at the guests around the pool (almost entirely elderly and families with young kids) something a little more chilled would have been preferable. The loud beat and tinny sound from the music stopped us relaxing by the pool - otherwise it could have been a tranquil place to relax.  
We were moved to a different room as our AirCon was not working. The replacement room was substandard - the bathroom door was so warped it would not close and the wardrobe door was missing. The shower had weak flow. We asked to be moved back to our original room once the AirCon was fixed, . 
There was also a wedding or party one night we were there, which took place in a function room above guest suites, so we had to endure loud base until 11.30pm. No warning of this, nor any apology when we complained to Reception. 
There is a designated beach area for the sole use of Anantamaa guests, bit it had limited sun loungers and you need to get there early to secure one. There were only four parasols and one was blown away by the wind and removed by staff, never to return.  There had obviously been an effort to clean up all the plastic rubbish from the sand, but it was just left in a big pile next to the loungers, which pretty much summed up the general feel of the hotel.
title: With some investment and updating, it could be so much better.

placeInfo: {'id': '7079606', 'name': 'Anantamaa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 393, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.615138, 'longitude': 81.21772, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d7079606-Reviews-Anantamaa-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.anantamaa.com', 'address': 'No 0742, Alles Garden, Trincomalee Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No 0742, Alles Garden', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 16, 'count2': 20, 'count3': 47, 'count4': 127, 'count5': 183}}
text:
Found this place at the last minute after our reserved properties turned out to be not suitable for our stay.

This is definitely a hidden gem in touristic Trincomalee. 

Their front office staff service is great. Dinesh & other staff whose names I forgot were very helpful. One of our room's AC wasn't working, so they quickly changed and offered a different room. 

Rooms were clean, bathroom is big enough. Pool is clean & good for nice swim in hot Trinco weather.

We wanted to check out early in the morning, staff arranged us packed breakfast. Very thoughtful & nice gesture.

Only negative I could say is water pressure in shower was so damn slow.
Their room service could improve. It would have been nice if they provided clothes Rack for each room.

Overall it was a pleasant experience for us and good value for money.
title: Peaceful & Quiet stay for 2 nights

placeInfo: {'id': '7079606', 'name': 'Anantamaa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 393, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.615138, 'longitude': 81.21772, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d7079606-Reviews-Anantamaa-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.anantamaa.com', 'address': 'No 0742, Alles Garden, Trincomalee Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No 0742, Alles Garden', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 16, 'count2': 20, 'count3': 47, 'count4': 127, 'count5': 183}}
roomTip: Best place for your vaccinations
text:
We have stayed Anantamaa Hotel for several days . Their service is very friendly , rooms are very spacious and very clean . Hygiene level of the entire hotel is more than expected . I give them 100/100 for that 

They have maintained their hotel very well . 

Staff is very friendly and helpful. Managers and Executive at the hotel always ready to service their customers . 

This hotel has a nice pool where you can have good relaxing vibes .

They have own restaurant at the hotel . If you have concern about your food my best recommendation is to dine in from their restaurant 
The food was consistently good.Their meals were  prepared with care and extremely high standard.

Their restaurant manager and staff always ready to service you with their best and they always prioritize each and every persons requirements 

Safety is 100%  

I do recommend this hotel any one wished to travel Trinco . Iâ€™m so delighted that I have selected this hotel during my staying at Trinco 

This hotel all staff gave a great service. 

100% recommended
title: 100% Recommended

placeInfo: {'id': '7079606', 'name': 'Anantamaa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 393, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.615138, 'longitude': 81.21772, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d7079606-Reviews-Anantamaa-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.anantamaa.com', 'address': 'No 0742, Alles Garden, Trincomalee Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No 0742, Alles Garden', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': None}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 16, 'count2': 20, 'count3': 47, 'count4': 127, 'count5': 183}}
roomTip: Avoid booking on Half board or Full board basis....The value for money spent is not worth it....We felt very cheated.
text:
Superb hotel with a staff willing to always help out. Rooms were nice and comfortable with great service by the staff. The pool was well located and was well maintained.All in all, a hotel which has the potential to be the leading place of accomadation,but badly let down by the choice of food. We really felt cheated and disappointed when they served just a watery vegetable soup with 4 bowls of salads of mediocre quality and 5 dishes as the mains, where 2 dishes were plain rice and fried rice-out of the 5 dishes.Desert was just ice cream and curd., this too on the 24th of December dinner when guests expected a better spread than this, on Christmas Eve. Even more, we had to stand near the buffet and wait till the dishes were refilled even though they had just 5-6 varieties to refill, but they ran out of food,half way through the evening. The next dinner was even worse with just 2 Salads and just ice cream as the desert. Obviously the management was aware of the situation but they kept passing the ball towards each other instead of making amends.
So if you're planning to stay here, don't expect your moneys worth on meals. Better book on room only basis or B&B basis and eat else where.
title: Great Hotel,Disappointing Food Service.....Not worth the money

placeInfo: {'id': '2573046', 'name': 'Golden Beach Cottages', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 178, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.616711, 'longitude': 81.218414, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d2573046-Reviews-Golden_Beach_Cottages-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': None, 'address': 'Allesgarden, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Allesgarden', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '31000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 42, 'count5': 115}}
roomTip:
Take some time off the beach and take a Tuk-Tuk tour with Kajan to see Trincomalee.
I recommend the Sunrise Temple tour and Harbour Sunset.
text:
The location is fantastic, as previously mentioned and rooms have terraces, which are a great place to sit and relax with a cold beer.

We arranged a Tuk-Tuk tour with Kajan from the Cottages and he showed us around the area, which was really interesting to get off the beach and see the local life and culture in Trincomalee.  

Lots of options for snorkeling/diving/dolphin watching available.

The beach is clean and staff are helpful with everything you need.

Choice of restaurants within a short walk. The restaurant attached to the hotel is convenient but there are better options off the beach (Rice & Curry was a winner every time).

The staff are very helpful and the area feels very safe.

We really enjoyed our stay at Golden Beach Cottages and would go back in heart beat.
title: Laid back beach location, everything you need.

placeInfo: {'id': '2573046', 'name': 'Golden Beach Cottages', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 178, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.616711, 'longitude': 81.218414, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d2573046-Reviews-Golden_Beach_Cottages-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': None, 'address': 'Allesgarden, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Allesgarden', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '31000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 42, 'count5': 115}}
roomTip: Check carefully before booking whale watching and snorkelling trips. Not all they are cracked up to be
text:
Stayed 3 nights at this brilliant place, right on the golden beach at Trincomallee. We stepped straight from our bungalow onto the sands and had the best view over the sparkling water. What a treat! The beach bar/restaurant was right there, serving tasty brekkie, snacks and drinks all day and dinner in the evening. You could dine in the beach by candlelight. While not gourmet, the food was good and tasty and the staff were fun and friendly.
The room was large, the bed was huge and comfortable and the ensuite, while basic, had hot water and a good shower.
It was interesting to watch the local fishermen casting out their huge circular net, then dragging it ashore later in a well practised, very rhythmical routine.
There are also more bars and restaurants along the beach should you want variation.
Great choice for a few days relaxation.
title: Golden Beachfront

placeInfo: {'id': '2573046', 'name': 'Golden Beach Cottages', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 178, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.616711, 'longitude': 81.218414, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d2573046-Reviews-Golden_Beach_Cottages-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': None, 'address': 'Allesgarden, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Allesgarden', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '31000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 42, 'count5': 115}}
text:
Fantastic location with a view (rooms 1 and 2).
5 types of breakfast (from the list).
Restaurant.
Close to other restaurants - 7 minutes on foot.
Daily cleaning (outside).
Next to the diving center.
A good place to relax and explore Trincomalee (15 minutes by tuk tuk to the city center).
Uber won't pick up from there :) Try to get to the main road and take a tuk tuk.
title: Good location

text:
This is our 1st time coming to Trinco Blu by Cinnamon.  We are from Ottawa Canada.  We were referred to this prestigious hotel by one of our friends who has stayed before.  And we are not disappointed.  And will return back when we are on Sri Lanka next time.  We have already recommended it one of our friends from the UK who plans to visit next year 

We are so impressed by the service.  Every single one of the staff is so obliging and courteous.  The Chef and his staff in the dining room are excellent.  They made sure we got the best service.  We were able to enjoy so many authentic Sri Lanka food along with so much choice.  Jeyanthan and the rest of his team excelled in their service. Francis at the front desk was very courteous and professional and respectful 

Michael and Christine Ponnuthurai
title: Our Stay at Trinco Blu by Cinnamon

placeInfo: {'id': '1775384', 'name': 'Trinco Blu By Cinnamon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2741, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.617864, 'longitude': 81.21754, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d1775384-Reviews-Trinco_Blu_By_Cinnamon-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.cinnamonhotels.com/trincoblucinnamon', 'address': 'Sarvodaya Rd, Trincomalee 83408 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Sarvodaya Rd', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '83408'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 61, 'count2': 93, 'count3': 292, 'count4': 821, 'count5': 1474}}
text:
My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in October 2024.

1.	Good Points
a.	This hotel is situated well beside the sea. 5-10Min walk to food restaurants.
b.	The room and toilet were clean.
c.	The staffs were friendly and very accommodating to our requests.
d.	The hotel has a bar overseeing the beach. This was my personal favorite.
e.	The buffet breakfast had decent amount of food variety, mostly Indian food of course, and it was all tasty.

2.	Bad Points
a.	I paid USD200 Per Night (including taxes) for the Superior room. Sadly, the room came with limited view of the beach. My roomâ€™s balcony was facing the swimming pool and had many trees, thus blocking my view of the beach.
b.	The hotel does have a swimming pool, but you wouldnâ€™t want to swim in it. There are plenty of stray dogs within the hotel compound, and it pisses in the swimming pool, licks the water from the swimming pool and jumps into the swimming pool, when there's no crowd. 
c.	Black crows are also aplenty within the hotel compound, and licks the water from the swimming pool too.
d.	The beach and sea is just OK, nothing great.

3.	Will I return again to this hotel?
No.
title: Nice Hotel But Can Be Better

text: I had a terrible experience with the reservation. I booked the hotel online through Cinnamon call center and paid more than half of the reservation amount but when I went to check in they couldn't find my reservation details. So I think they made a new bill. So when I was checking out they gave me a bill without deducting the amount I paid for the reservation online. So I had to show them the Email I received and send a copy of the reservation details to one of the receptionists' WhatsApp to confirm the first payment I made for the booking. It took time and I was waiting with my 2-year-old child to finish this up in the reception area. Then they gave me a new bill with the deducted amount. Then I paid through my card and the amount was deducted from my account but they said that they didnâ€™t receive the amount. It was a just WTF moment for me. I called the bank from my side and they said the amount was deducted from your side and received by the merchant too but the hotel staff refused to accept it. So I have to spend another few hours there with my baby. They came to me and said they hadnâ€™t received the money multiple times but the bank from my side confirmed that they had received the amount. It was not my fault. Finally, the hotel staff has to reverse the payment through the POS system. So that means they have received the amount but I didnâ€™t show up from there said. So Itâ€™s completely their fault. The bank also informed me after I got the payment back that my payment had gone through. So the payment reversal is also done by the hotel not by the bank. So it was not the bank or my cardâ€™s fault. So I have to spend over 2 hours in the reception. They didnâ€™t even give us a drink while we were waiting. I have gone to so many hotels but this behavior is not acceptable. They should make the guests comfortable. Mistakes can happen they should not make the guest feel uncomfortable. This is my first visit to a cinnamon hotel and the experience is not good.
title: It was a terrible experience

text:
I booked a 2-night stay at Trinco Blu by Cinnamon with a colleague from another country, as we had some work commitments in the area. Given my trust in the Cinnamon Hotels chain and its connection to John Keells Holdings, I was confident it would meet our expectations. We reserved a Superior Ocean View Room, but unfortunately, the experience was far from smooth.

Upon checking in around 5 p.m., the roomâ€™s air conditioning wasnâ€™t working. Despite informing the staff immediately, it took several hours to resolve the issue and even longer for them to decide to offer us an alternative room. The substitute room, however, came with its own problemsâ€”it was infested with mosquitoes. Although we requested and received a vaporizer, this should have been proactively provided, given the situation.

Additionally, the washrooms were not well-maintained, which further added to the disappointment. For a hotel of this caliber, I expected much better attention to detail and more efficient problem-solving. Overall, the stay did not live up to the standards I anticipated.
title: Disappointing stay despite trusted brand: Issues with Room and Maintenance at Trinco Blu by Cinnamon

placeInfo: {'id': '1775384', 'name': 'Trinco Blu By Cinnamon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2741, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.617864, 'longitude': 81.21754, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d1775384-Reviews-Trinco_Blu_By_Cinnamon-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.cinnamonhotels.com/trincoblucinnamon', 'address': 'Sarvodaya Rd, Trincomalee 83408 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Sarvodaya Rd', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '83408'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 61, 'count2': 93, 'count3': 292, 'count4': 821, 'count5': 1474}}
text:
We booked Trinco Blu for 3 days and had a lovely stay. Check-in was smooth and we were given lovely cold cinnamon welcome drinks on arrival. We stayed in room 402, which offered both pool and sea views. The direct access to the beach was great and we enjoyed being able to step out onto the beach at anytime. The beach was clean, there were plenty of sunbeds available and the pool/beach staff were very helpful in providing beach towels and sunbed mattresses. We were also able to order drinks that were brought over to us on the beach. We enjoyed lovely sunrise and evening walks along the beach. The breakfast and dinner buffets had a wide variety and we enjoyed our meals during our stay. We also had lunch at The Crab twice and the food and drinks were very good. The staff in both restaurants were friendly and accommodating. 

The hotel needs updating as some parts look tired and worn out, including the mirrors behind the reception desks, this is important for first impressions. Although there is a light natural breeze at the entrance, ceiling fans would help keep the area and guests cooler when checking-in and out. Housekeeping is offered twice daily, which is helpful given the mess that can come into your room following an afternoon at the beach. We personally wouldn't have minded if the room had a broom, so we could sweep up sand etc. after ourselves rather than wait for housekeeping later in the day. A mat or towel by the beach entrance door would also be good to wipe your feet after rinsing off before stepping into your room. The ceiling shower and toiletries were good, we felt it would have been useful to also have a handheld shower to rinse off the shower area once finished. The bins in the room and bathroom were rusty and could easily be replaced. We found the live music at dinner to be a little loud and not to everyone's taste. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful when needed. We will definitely return to Trinco Blu and would recommend to family and friends.
title: Lovely stay at Trinco Blu
