placeInfo: {'id': '1775384', 'name': 'Trinco Blu By Cinnamon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2741, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.617864, 'longitude': 81.21754, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d1775384-Reviews-Trinco_Blu_By_Cinnamon-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.cinnamonhotels.com/trincoblucinnamon', 'address': 'Sarvodaya Rd, Trincomalee 83408 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Sarvodaya Rd', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '83408'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 61, 'count2': 93, 'count3': 292, 'count4': 821, 'count5': 1474}}
text:
The hotel is beautiful. The pool is well maintained with 0.95m-1.05m depth. The beach is very beautiful and the views are really lovely. We could see fishermen bringing in fish from the sea which was truly beautiful and a highlight of the stay.
The sea is clean and great to go into. Lovely sandy beach. 
The staff are very friendly and helpful. Especially Kasun in The Crab and Mahesh in the main restaurant. 
The hotel room rate and food prices are really expensive. A meal (one starter and 2 mains) cost around 12000-15000 Rs. which is Â£30-40. Therefore, I expected more for this price. 
The maintenance aspects of the room needs to be improved with regular checks being conducted to ensure smooth operation of the air conditioning and toilet facilities.
Overall ok.
title: Not worth it

roomTip: Stray dogs are at the hotel we saw 2/3
text:
We had a lovely time at the Trinco Blu , it was so thoughtful to receive a room upgrade and cake which was such a thoughtful kind gesture to commemorate our 30 th wedding anniversary .
Service throughout was very good , attentive service with the usual lovely Sri Lankan smile ! 
Buffet breakfast had a good choice . We canâ€™t comment on dinner as we didnâ€™t eat at the hotel . We did have lunch at the crab beach bar which was fine .

The only issue was the stray dogs which is a massive issues around the island . Despite signs requesting not to feed the animals we saw guests feeding them which just feels  like losing an endless battle !  Not sure what the answer is but if you really donâ€™t like dogs this may not be the hotel for you .
title: Enjoyable stay , lovely beach setting

placeInfo: {'id': '1775384', 'name': 'Trinco Blu By Cinnamon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2741, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.617864, 'longitude': 81.21754, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d1775384-Reviews-Trinco_Blu_By_Cinnamon-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.cinnamonhotels.com/trincoblucinnamon', 'address': 'Sarvodaya Rd, Trincomalee 83408 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Sarvodaya Rd', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '83408'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 61, 'count2': 93, 'count3': 292, 'count4': 821, 'count5': 1474}}
roomTip: This is the place for ocean lovers and sea swimmers and surfers.
text:
We drove almost 7 hours from Colombo to reach Trincomalee. Trinco Bluâ€™s approach might disguise you but as you enter you know you have reached the most lovable location for your vacation. I have decided to review on different parameters from now on, here it is:
Reception &checkin- A smiling and warm reception, cold and sweet passion fruit welcome drink, checkin smooth. Rated 5 on a scale of 1-5
Room- small compact room, little crowded, first floor, sea facing, quite airy, very effective Aircon, Tea coffee maker with sachets. Sitting are outside the room with two chairs, small table, and a lying down cushion. Rated 4.5
Bathroom- a large bathroom and an open air shower. Basics provided in the bathroom (bottled shampoo, shower gel and body lotion) , warm tab provides lukewarm water only. Rated-4
Food- Breakfast was better than dinner. Though they have a separate restaurant for seafood may be that is the reason the seafood was just for namesake in the buffet dinner. Everything was tasty and displayed professionally. Rated - 4.5
Bar- non air conditioning area with fans, open to the lawns, carry your drink anywhere. We tried a special Sri Lankan liqueur branded Narikela, we both fell in love with the drink and later bought one from the market for the rest of the trip. Rated- 5
Hospitality and Service- A very polite and service oriented staff. A special mention of Pratheep and Ursula at the reception. Rated- 5
Overall rating- overall I will rate Trincomalee Blu at 4.7 out of five. 
Suggestions for travellers: Dolphin watching is fun especially when you are with kids but donâ€™t fall for the random guy who reaches you on the sea shore and offers cheap price. Always reach out to the hotel and book from them, though expensive but suggested for safety and other reasons.
title: Lovely location, sea loverâ€™s paradise

placeInfo: {'id': '1775384', 'name': 'Trinco Blu By Cinnamon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2741, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.617864, 'longitude': 81.21754, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d1775384-Reviews-Trinco_Blu_By_Cinnamon-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.cinnamonhotels.com/trincoblucinnamon', 'address': 'Sarvodaya Rd, Trincomalee 83408 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Sarvodaya Rd', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '83408'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 61, 'count2': 93, 'count3': 292, 'count4': 821, 'count5': 1474}}
text:
My husband and I came here as a treat to ourselves. As non expatriate locals living in Sri Lanka the half board price was pretty steep for us. But we indulged and splurged as the place looked amazing. As did the ocean

TRINCO BLU didnt fail to disappoint 
Firstly the superior room was very well maintained, clean and had a great view and ambience similar to the hotel. Very relaxed vibes. Pool was well equipped with showers, towels and constantly kept clean. Beach was similarly upkept with no touts and pristine white sand. Blessed with an ocean of dreams. I've never seen a sea more blue where you could wade out to calm waters for miles. 

Buffet of dinner and breakfast were top class. 10/10 Cinnamon! Me being a foodie i have to say the variety was unmatchable. we had delicious crab, squid, fish and a variety of meat preparations. International buffet with Indian western and fabulous traditional Eastern province local preparations. Breakfast on a Thursday had freshly made hoppers pol rotti and even a fabulous "Diya Buth". Apart from the traditional English breakfast specials there was an area traditional sweet milk rice as well. Very large and lavish spread!

Last but not least staff hospitality was excellent. From reception to dining staff everyone was courteous and accommodative. We checked out on Friday at 12pm and hung around for our train till 7pm. We were even given a proper room space for the ten min of prayers we required without shoving us into an odd corner. This I thought was next level. In a hotel at capacity bookings with foreign guests the care shown to the few locals was truly commendable. Much respect and love.

It must be mentioned the Live music singer was one of the best iv heard, singing local songs and a vocal range covering Guns & Roses, Michael Jackson and Bob Marley!

I would definitely save up to return again. 9.5/10 rating. This is definitely the best hotel in Trinco. If you are visiting Sri Lanka take it from a local with fairly stringent standards, Trinco blu surpasses expectations. Couldn't find a better hotel for genuine sri lankan warmth and quality refinement in hospitality ðŸ‘Œ
title: Nothing short off TrincoBlu in the East!

roomTip: Not enough pool towels in the evening.
text:
Most of the staff are very friendly go out of their way to make you comfortable and help you. In particular Mr Rajinthan who is very polite and respectful. Goes above and beyond with all the guests. 
The two ladies at the Hopper station Jasintha and Vijitha, also once again very courteous and professional and produced tasty hoppers. Even in the heat of the burners they were smiling and happy to serve.
Chef Charmika at the egg and waffles station is extremely polite was very quick and was very happy to oblige Food is tasty, have a good variety of dishes.
Mahesh the lovely gentleman who pours coffees and teas wonderful service very attentive. 
Majority of the restaurant staff are well trained. F &B manager is Def doing something correct to keep them motivated. 

The rooms are clean. House keeping efficient. 
On the whole very pleasant stay.
title: Hospitality with a smile

text:
Excellent hotel close to the beach with a view on the lagon ! Swimming pool and jacuzzi outside perfect to relax, it's calm and peaceful. 
We had a beautiful room with an indoor jacuzzi and they did a sweet gesture with flowers in (and towels forming an heart on the bed). It was clean, calm and had an amazing view too. 
The restaurant was very good ! We chose HB so we had dinner there with enough options to be completly satisfied. They even offered us a delicious meal (prawn and rice) in addition to our dinner. 
The personnal members here were very kind and helpful, always taking care of us in the best way. Special thank you to the restaurants manager Sunil and his team for their best care. 

Also thank you to Priwin for taking care of our reservation and Mayuran for taking care of us at our arrival at the hotel. 

ChloÃ© & Dilane Tikiri Banda
title: Perfect hotel !

placeInfo: {'id': '7788909', 'name': 'Amaranthe Bay Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1022, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.618372, 'longitude': 81.21544, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d7788909-Reviews-Amaranthe_Bay_Resort-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.amaranthebay.com', 'address': 'No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '31000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 12, 'count2': 18, 'count3': 34, 'count4': 172, 'count5': 787}}
text:
Unfortunately, in my opinion, this hotel did not live up to all of the 5* the reviews. In contrast to every other hotel we visited in Sri Lanka (we had stayed in 6 prior to this hotel) the management at this hotel was absent! The junior suite was very spacious and the beds were comfortable but like the hotel, the room lacked any type of character. The AC unit in the room was it working when we arrived and neither were several of the power sockets.  Once reported, the management promptly sent out an engineer who managed to fix everything. The AC went off again the next night due to a powercut but the back up generator did not kick in for several hours as we were woken up at 5am by the heat! 
The bathroom was rather dated and the towels were not white and fluffy but an off white colour and fraying at the edges (and one had holes).  The pathway to the rooms were also in need of repair with cracked tiles in  several places. 
The pool is a good size but the sunbeds are old and quite rickety.   
Breakfast was ok and buffet style with a mixture of both Sri Lankan and western options. Lunch and dinner however were al la carte and they were both very good, serving some of the best food we had during our stay in Sri Lanka. If you are in the area itâ€™s worth popping in for lunch/dinner, you wonâ€™t be disappointed!
title: Ok hotel but they do serve lovely food

placeInfo: {'id': '7788909', 'name': 'Amaranthe Bay Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1022, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.618372, 'longitude': 81.21544, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d7788909-Reviews-Amaranthe_Bay_Resort-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.amaranthebay.com', 'address': 'No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '31000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 12, 'count2': 18, 'count3': 34, 'count4': 172, 'count5': 787}}
text:
Weâ€™ve just spent two nights at the Amaranthe Bay Hotel where nothing is as it seems. On arrival the hotel looks OK and the prices would suggest it is of 4 star standard however this is actually not the case. We paid US$158 per night for what we thought was a mini suite room however turned out to be the adjacent room to the executive suite. We were under the impression that the room contained a king size bed however it was a queen and my husband who is 6â€™1â€ was too long and his legs hung over the end.

Nothing in the room worked properly. The power pads control numerous lights, fans, etc however some didnâ€™t work and others controlled things they shouldnâ€™t. For example, when you turned off the light above the mirror it also turned off the fan and AC. The second AC unit turned itself off at night and so the bedroom was unbearably hot at night necessitating the fan being switched to high. We advised reception and to their credit they contacted maintenance who came to fix it however it stopped again.

We purchased B&B and breakfast was quite the experience. The poached eggs were precooked and sitting in a Bain Marie which meant they were hard and rubbery. There was carrots vichy, garlic spinach and cooked zucchini together with a multitude of sweets aimed at the children.

The pool area is quite nice however there are insufficient loungers for the number of guests.

The hotel is not on a beach and is about a 10 minute walk from Upavilla Beach. The beach is lovely. 

The problem is there are only two high end hotels so there is no competition.
title: Sri Lankan Fawlty Towers

text:
The room was very nice although there were minor issues such as the WiFi cutting out &
The air-conditioning not functioning properly. But had wonderful jacuzzis and massive room space. The staff were very nice especially the pool person! text:
TLDR: The worst hotel we stayed in in Sri Lanka. Very over-priced for what it is, terrible management & not good for young children! 

To start with the positives: in general, the outdoor space is nice, and the restaurant and pool staff are really lovely. The chef is also super nice. The breakfast spread is decent. The suite room was large.

The negatives: The fact that there was a bat in our room, and that the manager accused us of making it up / that we let them in by leaving the door open. There was an obvious hole in the roof. Refused to give refund for the night we had to vacate our bat-room at nearly midnight with a 4 month old baby. Offered an insulting 40 USD discount on room extras that we declined. 

A very overpriced stay (370 a night) and the hotel decor and finishings feel cheap & tacky with no hospitality from management. Not worth it at all, and not a luxurious hotel at all.
title: worst hotel we stayed in in Sri Lanka. Over-priced, bad management & not good for young children

placeInfo: {'id': '7788909', 'name': 'Amaranthe Bay Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1022, 'locationString': 'Trincomalee, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 8.618372, 'longitude': 81.21544, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g424963-d7788909-Reviews-Amaranthe_Bay_Resort-Trincomalee_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.amaranthebay.com', 'address': 'No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No. 101/17 Alles Garden Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Trincomalee', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '31000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 12, 'count2': 18, 'count3': 34, 'count4': 172, 'count5': 787}}
text:
The hotel welcomes you with a homely feeling of secluded by trees and flower plants. We were greeted by Mayuran who was very helpful through our stay .fast check in and out . 
The hotel has a great pool which over looks the lagoon . During our stay the lagoon water was low . Hotel does not have a beach on its own .  Has to share beach with other hotels . 300 m walk to beach . We did not try this as our plans worked out for us to be at the Nilaveli beach .
Hotel rooms are very spacious with a large jacuzzi . We had a king bed and a roller bed and still lots of room to move around .
Bathrooms were clean and spacious . 
Mayuran was able to recommend tours offered by the hotel . We took the lagoon ride in a canoe and dolphin watching . 
Lagoon ride was fun and different . You get to see some birds and jumping fish . 
And able to enjoy sunset if lucky . Our day was cloudy . But still enjoyed sitting on rocks and  enjoyed the hotelâ€™s complement snack pack . The chocolate cake and rolls were really tasty . Our canoe guide Suji made the ride fun and made sure it was safe . 
We had so much fun with dolphin watching . As it was the season  we Saw many dolphins . 
Have to mention the breakfast . The Buffett had western and local food . We  enjoyed the local food very much .
Overall very good feeling during our stay .
title: Feel good 2 days at AmaranthÃ© !

roomTip: We came at the start of July and left on 10th just as it became more full with families on summer holidays. This is low season and uncrowded
text: The hotel property was beautiful including the gorgeous tropical plantings and pool, nestled alongside the lagoon. The food was amazing with both western and Sri Lankan options, both using fresh ingredients, expertly prepared and served with a smile. The rooms are spacious boasting a jacuzzi with a view and a decently sized balcony. Also lots of activities to be had nearby (recommend snorkelling at Pigeon Island and the dolphin spotting trips). Hotel staff  were very helpful and cheerful. We loved our stay here and really recommend this hotel!!
title: Great hotel with superb food and welcoming environments

roomTip: Just visit!
text: From the moment we entered this hotel we were made to feel so welcome by Roshan on reception. Then we stepped into our upgraded very luxurious room and were blown away. Panoramic windows provided a fabulous view of the lagoon and beautiful scenery with the addition of a gorgeous jacuzzi bath which sadly we had no time to use. Service at the pool bar was excellent as was the service in the restaurant. Try the seafood platter you will not regret it. Crab, prawns, cuttle fish, tuna etc all cooked to perfection. We would recommend this hotel to everyone who visits Trincomalee.
title: Amazing Amaranthe Bay

text:
We spent two nights at Amaranthe Bay and it was an enjoyable stay. A junior suite on the ground floor with the beautiful view of the lagoon from the patio or your own jacuzzi was a great experience. Though the hotel was not by the sea if had its own charm. 
The food on the buffet and the set menu was excellent for all palates. Although we did not have a dinner buffet I recommend tasting the local cuisine on the breakfast buffet. 
It was a pleasure to meet Kirujan, Chaturanga and Soothan who served during our stay. They were attentive and respectful. Overall a great stay!
title: A hotel worth staying!

text: I visited Deer Park Giritale with my family and had a fantastic experience. Since it was a long weekend ( Sep 15th and 16th) all the rooms were fully booked. Although we initially requested a pool view rooms which is closer to restaurant it was not communicated properly and we were given rooms bit far from the restaurant and lobby, which was difficult to walk to my parents and we couldn't change it at the last minute. However, Mr. Joseph ( Hotel Manager) and Harshaka ( Guest Coordinator)found a good solution and they manage to allocate a nearby rooms for us to enjoy our stay. The rooms were clean and of high quality, and the food was delicious. Overall, it was a lovely experience with beautiful view facing Giritale Lake. I highly recommend this place because of the view, food and good customer experience.
title: Splendid Experience at Hotel Deer Park, Giritale

placeInfo: {'id': '447419', 'name': 'Deer Park Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 826, 'locationString': 'Polonnaruwa, North Central Province', 'latitude': 7.990125, 'longitude': 80.92164, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304140-d447419-Reviews-Deer_Park_Hotel-Polonnaruwa_North_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.deerparksrilanka.com/', 'address': 'Elahera Road, Polonnaruwa 51000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Elahera Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Polonnaruwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '51000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 29, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 92, 'count4': 278, 'count5': 396}}
roomTip: Keep an eye on the sneaking monkeys and try a drink on the deck in the night
text:
What you sense as you enter the Hotel premises would definitely take you to the Kingdom of Polonnaruwa around 1500 years back to the Ceylon History.
Absolutely a calm and wide spread hotel with scatteredly built villas of many designs standing out harmoniously with massive and old trees.
Villas are ideal for Romantic couples who share one soul and love extreme relaxation.
Very efficient and prompt staff is a great blessing and Mr Nizar.. The gentleman Group CEO does a marvelous fatherly job in pleasing every guest the pinnacle. 
Food is extremely fresh and scrumptious with a great variety and excellenty presented. 
I don't take the monkeys a menace. Those little creatures are a pleasure to observe. 
My best experience was the sipping of a whisky on the rocks, on the Moony night on the deck overlooking the wavy Girithale Tank.... To the tune of gloomy songs of cicadas. 
Extremely attracted to this Charming hotel
title: Enchanting yet Majestic hotel scattered over 75 acres of Massive whispering trees with a touch of old Ceylon architecture  along

roomTip: Enjoy the nature around the hotel. Don't expect a high standard of service.
text:
The Hotel is no longer what it used to be. It can be clearly seen it is run with an inadequate staff level. Hence service level is poor if there is even a moderate crowd. 
Et
Even though the hotel was not full on the day we checked-in and requesting for an early check-in about an hour before the normal time, they could not give it on time. Further the AC didn't work. The indoor outdoor  bathroom was good and the bed was good.

Lunch buffet was reasonable but nothing to rave about. Dinner choice was limited. Breakfast choice was the best of the 3 meals. 

The view from the garden was good except that the main electricity supply line on the road is a distraction to the view. 

Since there is a limited choice in hotels close to Polonnaruwa and Minneriya National Park this a hotel one would choose by default rather than choice. 

I hope with the increase if tourism in Sri Lanka the management will refurbish the hotel and increase the staff to provide a better service.
title: Not as good as it used to be

placeInfo: {'id': '447419', 'name': 'Deer Park Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 826, 'locationString': 'Polonnaruwa, North Central Province', 'latitude': 7.990125, 'longitude': 80.92164, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304140-d447419-Reviews-Deer_Park_Hotel-Polonnaruwa_North_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.deerparksrilanka.com/', 'address': 'Elahera Road, Polonnaruwa 51000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Elahera Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Polonnaruwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '51000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 29, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 92, 'count4': 278, 'count5': 396}}
roomTip: Do not use this hotel because they are putting customer's life at risk...
text:
We booked two nights at the Deer Park hotel, Polonnaruwa, Sir Lanka. From the outside it looks nice and in a good location, but CLERALY VISIBLE LACK OF MAINTAINENCE has ruined this hotel. Just before we got to the hotel there's some rain, but we did not think anything of it. When we got the room key, we went to the room, and ground floor little living room and toilet/bathroom and the bedroom was upstairs. This wasn't ideal for us because we would have preferred to have an attached toilet. Anyhow, when we checked the bed there was some animal droppings looks like rat dropping were on the bed. We called the reception BUT HAD NO RESPONSE.  

We had to go back to the reception even when it was raining to resolve this issue. Manager-in-charge I believed called Joseph assured us not to worried it is not rat and the will clean the room spot less for us. After hanging round about 30 minutes in the reception we went to the room around 9 pm and I wanted to have a shower therefore, went to the toilet/bathroom area and noticed there was no lights to the bathroom area. My husband used his mobile torch light to see what was there. Bath tub was full covered with black dead animals therefore again had to go to the reception because as usual no one answered the phone...

Second time round not only the manager, I managed to speak to the Group CEO named Mr M I M Nizar and he was trying to convince us that this hotel is in a jungle and NOT in the city of Polonnaruwa!!! According to the Group CEO, as a customer, we should expect animal droppings on the bed as well as dead animals on the floor and the bathroom area including no lights and be able to clean it ourself without making any fuss!!! I mentioned that I am a patient with heart, diabetic and several other illnesses therefore any animal bit could be very dangerous for me. He laughed say that's nothing to worry about!!! 

After so much fuss, we managed to get a temporary light fitted to the bathroom area using a black cable and a very tall dated light should not be recommended to use in a bathroom area at all.  When we looked after they finished this temporary light installation, we could not workout water was coming from the rain though the roof area including the dirt and the dead animals or the shower... We gave up having shower or bath in the end. We tried to used the wash basin in the toilet area and you could see how dirty the mirror was including the rust coming through it and my husband tripped over the cable on the floor and the temporary light switched off. We were far too exhausted by then and went to eat something from the restaurant and they charged us Sri Lankan Rupees 11,500 but hardly anything worth while was there to eat, but being so frustrated and tired we went to the room to sleep.

Next day morning, I took some pictures of the bathroom area roof and the bathtub after cleaned by the hotel staff, temporary light which was fixed to the plug point using two cables without a plug! This Hotel was breaching Electricity; Slips and trips; and HEALTH AND SAFETY Regulation and put our lives at risk. I never come a cross or heard of this kind of behaviour putting customers lives at risk to save few pence or to increase profit. Think not twice, hundred time before you put customers lives at risk like this... I only can say Group CEO and the Manager: Joseph should put themself in customer's (ours) shoes to understand is it worth killing customers for few pence of profit or cost cutting!!! 

Next day, we again mentioned this to the manager (Joseph) and he said he will do something about it. I tried to call Expedia becuase we booked this hotel from them, but not managed to speak to anyone before all my money run out from the mobile. That's worse! When we went to get something to eat before we leave the hotel, I mentioned to my husband it smell like a sewage near our room and when we checked there were some places near the footpath overflowing sewage mixed water outside from the drainages...

This is NOT A FIVE STAR HOTEL and MAY BE EVEN HELL IS BETTER THAN THIS.

I would appreciate if you could get the full refund for our stay including what we had to put up in this hotel.
title: Hell on earth - NOT A FIVE STAR HOTEL - BREACH HEALTH & SAFETY!!!

placeInfo: {'id': '447419', 'name': 'Deer Park Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 826, 'locationString': 'Polonnaruwa, North Central Province', 'latitude': 7.990125, 'longitude': 80.92164, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304140-d447419-Reviews-Deer_Park_Hotel-Polonnaruwa_North_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.deerparksrilanka.com/', 'address': 'Elahera Road, Polonnaruwa 51000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Elahera Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Polonnaruwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '51000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 29, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 92, 'count4': 278, 'count5': 396}}
text:
I'd stayed at this hotel a few years ago.  My recent stay was similar.

There's no doubt the hotel looks out onto a beautiful lakeside setting, with a Buddhist wedding on one of the mornings we were there taking advantage of the nature lovers' view.

There were even some frogs croaking around teh hotel, always a good sign as to biodiversity.

Manger Joseph in the buffet restaurant had excellent English and really cared for the guests.  Since my last visit, the area had been expanded.  Food was kept warm to hot, something most like to see in buffets.

The resort has two side-by-side pools.  I did not use.

WiFi only worked outside the bar.

The room was a letdown, as it was loft style, with the bed, a small table and airconditioner up a flight of about 14 concrete stairs.  It was inconvenient at night to have to use stairs to access the toilet.  Anyone who was unsteady on their feet could fall down these concrete stairs.

The shower was roofed but had an outdoorsy feel to it.  Hot water worked well.  Downstairs only had a round table and two chairs, and a rudimentary hanging space with a couple of hangers.  A suitcase shelf was not provided even though what can be a handy feature would have fitted in the room.

Overall because of the loft style, the hotel has to be marked down.  Not all rooms are like this but one elderly lady had to swap rooms to a non-loft syle one.  If the hotel had been full, she would have had unsuitable accommodation.
title: Good manager and buffet, but loft rooms inconvenient

text:
My sister and I stayed at EKHO Lake House for two nights and were blown away by the tranquillity and peaceful atmosphere. The hotelâ€™s rich history, especially the Royal Suite, added a unique charm. 

We spent a lot of time at the hotel, simply because the view was so beautiful and relaxing. 

We enjoyed a calming Ayurvedic massage in our room, which the hotel kindly arranged through a third party. The manager was also incredibly helpful, organizing a tuk-tuk tour of the ancient city, which allowed us to see many fascinating historical sites. The hotel's location is perfect and right at the heart of these sites 

The food was a nice mix of Asian and Western dishes, all fresh and delicious. The service was exceptional, especially from Arun, who made our stay even more enjoyable. His hospitality was outstanding and his cocktail-making skills are not to be missed! Particularly his PiÃ±a Colada! 

The pool and restaurant quickly became our favorite spots to unwind, especially with the wildlife around. I regularly spotted eagles, pelicans, beautiful butterflies, chipmunks and even an occasional toque macaque.

If you are looking for a serene escape with great service and a convenient location, I highly recommend EKHO Lake House!
title: Serene escape!

text: We loved everything about the Ekho Lake House. We stayed in the Royal Suite which was so worth it! It came with a private garden area and a hot tub. The lake views were so beautiful and relaxing. Also, we really enjoyed the food at the restaurant. If you want to try authentic Sri Lankan food, you should get the Rice and Curry dish. The live music during dinner was a plus. The staff was so friendly and the service was superb. Don't miss out on the sunset boat tour. We got to see some breath taking views! Overall, the best hotel we stayed at in Sri Lanka. Can't wait to come back!.
title: Our favourite hotel in Sri Lanka!

text: We had one of the best hotel experiences at EKHO Lake House Polonnaruwa. The location was stunning with mesmerising view of Prakrama Samudraya resovoir and scenic sunsets. The ambiance of the hotel is so relaxing and the rooms were comfortable and well maintained. We felt like home with the kind and helpful hotel staff and special thanks should be given to Mr. Arun. The food was delicious with great presentation and variety. Polonnaruwa ancient city was at walking distance to the hotel and we had relaxing strolls to the archeological sites with ease. I yearn to visit this place again with my family. We highly recommend this place to both local and foriegn tourists.
title: Mesmerising, Relaxing and the best location

placeInfo: {'id': '6921675', 'name': 'Ekho Lake House', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 303, 'locationString': 'Polonnaruwa, North Central Province', 'latitude': 7.942686, 'longitude': 80.997116, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304140-d6921675-Reviews-Ekho_Lake_House-Polonnaruwa_North_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.ekhohotels.com/ekholakehouse/', 'address': 'Pothgul Mawatha, Polonnaruwa 51000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pothgul Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Polonnaruwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '51000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 4, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 253}}
roomTip: This is the best place to stay in Polonnaruwa
text:
We had a wonderful stay at Ekho Lake House Polonnaruwa. This is probably the best plce to stay Polonnaruwa. It has the elgance of international standards. The staff is exceptionally good. They provided us with kiripidu pojawa for Somawathi temple. We feel the management is not capitalising when marketting the place. Following are some of the points they should consider for marketing:
1. The hotel is situated nearlly on top of Parakrama Samudraya lake giving magnificent views for the rooms. There are no other hotels which provides this in Polonnaruwa.
2. You can watch elephnats bathing. Ideally the hotel should have binoculors for the visitors to watch the beauty of elephant baths. 
3. The hotel seems to have built in 17th or 18th century. Queen Elezebath has stayed in this hotel in 1954 during her Royal visit to Polonnaruwa. You can book this room and use the Roayl batch tub. Unfortaullately I got to know about the room only during my stay, otherwise I would have booked this room.
4. Hotel is almost on the smae premises as King Nissankamalla's palace and parliament built in 12th century. Magnificet ruins are only few feet away.
If you re going to Polonnaruwa then Ekho Lake is The place to stay.
title: Exotic stay in Polonnaruwa

text:
We stayed there for the last leg of our journey in Sri Lanka and it could not have been a better last night in this beautiful country. The room was clean and spacious, and we were offered a tour of the Queen Elizabeth II bedroom. The staff was more than perfect; we felt valued during our stay and they made sure everything was ok without being too present. We had the chance of having a group of three musicians singing for us for a few minutes while we were sipping champagne on the water front. 

Special thanks to Priyantha who was amazing from start to finish and to Isuru as well :)
title: Even better than expected, what a hotel...

text:
We were very sad to check out today. It was the best end to our fantastic 20 day holiday in Sri Lanka. The hotel is simply beautiful internally and externally. The staff are amazing. The food was consistently excellent. We booked on a half-board basis direct with the hotel because it was not clear from booking sites whether the rooms fit an additional bed for our son (they do). Booking direct was significantly cheaper than the cost on the sites. 

1 minute walk from the UNESCO site entrance, a pool, quiet, stunning views, huge rooms, spotless, wildlife such as bats, excellent staff, great chef. What more could you ever ask for in a hotel. A must.
title: Perfect

roomTip: Plentiful parking, walkable to local town with ATMs, restaurants and more.
text: Absolutely amazing. The property is beautifully situated on a lovely lake with pelicans, Brahmins kites and more. Beautiful frangipani trees throughout the property. Serene and beautiful views from the dining room. Only twelve rooms, so has a cosy feel and the pool is not huge but big enough. Relax and watch the fishermen, stroll into town (ten minutes) to dine at the many restaurants. Staff are friendly, attentive and helpful but did not hover. The rooms and hotel areas are beautifully appointed with local art and colonial style furniture. Reasonably good wifi. No jet-skis or speedboats. Close to safari parks and jeeps will pick up at the hotel. Food is great. Sri Lankan curries (pictures) are served elegantly and food is plentiful and delicious. Would definitely return for another stay.
title: A peaceful and wonderful stay, with stunning sunsets and elephant safaris and UNESCO site  nearby.

placeInfo: {'id': '6921675', 'name': 'Ekho Lake House', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 303, 'locationString': 'Polonnaruwa, North Central Province', 'latitude': 7.942686, 'longitude': 80.997116, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304140-d6921675-Reviews-Ekho_Lake_House-Polonnaruwa_North_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.ekhohotels.com/ekholakehouse/', 'address': 'Pothgul Mawatha, Polonnaruwa 51000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pothgul Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Polonnaruwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '51000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 4, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 253}}
roomTip: Take the evening lake boat ride - it's well worth it!
text:
I stayed three nights in the royal suite, which was well worth the cost of the upgrade.  I valued especially the private views across the lake, or "next door" to the little temple island where the local kids swim at dusk.  Early mornings and early evenings outside of the beautiful suite there were always wonderful things to see.   One night the whole suite was filled with soft light from a full moon over the lake.  For one person, the suite was probably 'too much' - but for the peace and various comforts, I'd gladly do it again. The restaurant seemed incredibly flexible and caring - I am so grateful to the chef and waiters for introducing me to several fresh and local dishes.  One of the highlights of my whole trip to Sri Lanka had to have been an evening's boat trip from the EKHO Lake House across the lake to see the bird islands, and, as luck would have it, a gorgeous tusker enjoying the lakeside grasses for his supper.  The hotel is intimate, private, quiet - a truly perfect location for enjoying the ruins of Polonnaruwa (I toured them by bicycle from the hotel).  The staff here are welcoming, friendly, never pushy, always helpful.   It may be a small place, but in its care for detail it is a jewel.
I honestly can't imagine having a better experience.
title: a jewel of a place

roomTip: Book well in advance.
text: This old but beautifully restored and maintained Guest House is extremely nicely located by and indeed above Polonnaruwa's large wewa.  It has few rooms, ours had access to the garden and dining room nearby.  The rooms are very well appointed and comfortable, with all amenities one would expect in a 4-5 star establishment.  We were welcomed most friendly and efficiently, the service throughout our two-night stay was impeccable, considerate and generous.  The dining room is gorgeous, with lake views on almost all directions.  We had an excellent dinner, rice and curry, and enjoyed it so much that we had dinner there the second evening, sampling other items on the nice but not excessively long or costly menu.  Beers were available from the bar, either in a small lounge area in the dining room or outside our rooms on our private terrace.  The hotel is located very well for visits to the ancient sites, being right next to the museum.  We didn't use the very attractive pool.  This is an exceptionally agreeable and beautiful place to stay.
title: Beautiful historic lakeside Rest House

text:
Thank you to all especially Udesh at the hotel Ekho Lake in Polonnaruwa. 
Our previous hotel had to cancel our transport to Echo Lake Hotel because of the previous fuel issues in Sri Lanka. My husband called Echo Lake who immediately stepped up to the plate and organised a van to be with us pdq! 
So that was our first taste of what was to be a thoroughly enjoyable and memorable stay. 

The hotel is rightly proud of itâ€™s high food standards and we were very impressed with requests being accepted and standards surpassing expectations from the chef. Thank you. 

Our room was delightful, a home from home especially charming with signed photograph of the queen who stayed at the hotel during her visit to Sri Lanka in 1954.

The lake itself is the largest manmade lake in the world. As we arrived a fishing eagle swooped down and plucked a fish from the water. The view was pretty fantastic, tranquil and none of the smoke, from regular compost fires in Sri Lanka, made it across to us. Itâ€™s a fab place to sit and enjoy under the shade canopy with a light breeze cooling your brow.

If you can tear yourself away from her majestyâ€™s splendid gold bathtub then visit the ancient ruins of Polonnaruwa which are quite literally on the doorstep, well the ticket office is opposite the hotel. 

We felt thoroughly well looked after by Udesh and his team who were able to give us oodles of info on the area and suggestions for easy visiting of the rather large ruined city of Polonnaruwa.  Many other trips can be arranged. We found it hard to leave the calm and comfort, however the hotel offer boat trips on the lake and were willing to organise anything you have a mind to do.

It was a memorable stay. Highly recommend.
title: Tranquil and Foodie Delight

placeInfo: {'id': '6921675', 'name': 'Ekho Lake House', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 303, 'locationString': 'Polonnaruwa, North Central Province', 'latitude': 7.942686, 'longitude': 80.997116, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304140-d6921675-Reviews-Ekho_Lake_House-Polonnaruwa_North_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.ekhohotels.com/ekholakehouse/', 'address': 'Pothgul Mawatha, Polonnaruwa 51000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pothgul Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Polonnaruwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '51000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 4, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 253}}
text:
A fab little boutique hotel indeed. Even if you didn't realise its Royal Suite formed part of the British Royal Tour in 1954!

The colonial-style architecture is delightful, and the large, comfy rooms all benefit from it.  Ours had its own outside sun-lounging terrace AND an additional lakeside table that we used each night, although these can be occupied by other visitors too.

Sunsets on the lake are gorgeous - full-stop.

Food and drink options are great, although early breakfast needs pre-warning.

My fave aspect of Ekho Lake House, though, is its location relative to the (stupendous) Polunnaruwa site: it starts literally 20m from the Lake House - well, one grouping within the overall site does. Plus, the museum where one buys tickets for the whole site visit is a mere 3 mins' walk.
title: An understated gem

roomTip: If you can swing it, splurge and stay in the Royal Suite. If not get a deluxe room overlooking the lake. They are great too!
text: The unexpected highlight of our travels through Sri Lanka was spending a night at the Ekho Lake Hotel in the wood panelled suite where Queen Elizabeth II stayed with Prince Philip in 1954 -not long after her coronation. With its huge private terrace overlooking the lake, enormous dressing room, his and her sinks, gleaming brass chandeliers and large gold bathtub , the suite offers todayâ€™s visitor that rare chance to feel like royalty for a night. But if the suiteâ€™s price is too rich or just not available, go to Ekho Lake Hotel anyway! Its other deluxe rooms overlooking the lake with terrace and access to corner infinity poolâ€“are fabulous not only for the privilege of being right in the middle of this important architectural site long after the tour buses and crowds have gone but also for the chance to be welcomed by the hotelâ€™s unusually warm and professional staff. Dinner overlooking the lake at sunset was excellent.Thanks to the wise and extremely helpful advice of the hotelâ€™s manager, we waited until late afternoon to to tour the ruins, which are spread over a vast area.  Exhausted from the heat, we had told the manager that we might not be up for a multi-hour visit so he suggested we hire a tuk tuk for a one hour spin. The tuk tuk driver the manager suggested not only spoke the best English of almost anyone we met in Sri Lanka, but he also knew a great deal about Sri Lanka history and the ruins themselves. I only wish we had known how great this place was so we could have spent a second night at wonderful Ekho Lake Hotel - a real find!
title: Wish we had stayed two nights - Not to be missed!

text:
We booked to stay in this small boutique hotel situated with stunning views over a large ancient lake to explore the UNESCO Ancient City of Polonnaruwa. The entrance to the city is immediately outside the hotel.

The location is stunning with a small swimming pool and restaurant overlooking the water. Multiple eagles, water birds and elephants can be seen bathing in the water from the hotel. An amazing sight.

The restaurant needs special mention. We stayed for 3 nights Half Board and every single meal was excellent. Several choices for your main meal (a western style set). Alternatively substitute for a local style curry.

We had a lake view room which was large and very well furnished. The only real let down from the hotel and why I canâ€™t award 5 stars was our room was not cleaned for the entire stay. The first night was a confusion with the door sign to make up the room having fallen off the door and replaced with â€œdo not disturbâ€. The second night we avoided the sign completely, yet the room still wasnâ€™t cleaned during the day. We reported this to the staff and both nights they were excellent, arranging for the room to be cleaned during dinner. Donâ€™t let this put you off staying in this delightful hotel, but certainly a note to the hotel to fix this issue promptly.
title: Fantastic location for exploring the ancient city with wonderful lakeside views

text:
This was our and 2nd visit to Sri Lanka within the last 2 years and we decided we wanted to go to the cultural centre of Sri Lanka. We wanted a hotel that had a compelling history. EKHO Lake House not only had that but also one of the most stunning views in Sri Lanka. We booked into the Royal Suite which was very special indeed. The very suite were her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip stayed when they embarked on their first overseas tour after she was crowned. The room was stunning and had original features plus beautiful framed pictures of the Royal couple. We had our own personal jacuzzi and private grounds. 
The hotel staff and the service was excellent. They worked so hard and we have to pay homage to Priya who excelled above and beyond to make sure our stay was comfortable. He was there in the morning and int he evening. Nothing was too much trouble. My partner is Texan and when it comes to how is favourite drink is made can be quite vocal. The staff in the bar and restaurant were very accommodating and the food was excellent. On our first evening Chef promised us a special meal and it was excellent. Huge prawns from the lake that tasted delicious. The next day we had a Sri Lankan curry with all the trimmings. It was so tasty and we asked them to spice it up and they did it perfectly.
Highlight of our stay was the water safari that we did just before sunset. It was exquisite and so romantic and peaceful. Seeing the elephants was a joy to behold with the beautiful sunset as a backdrop. We will never forget it. This is a must do if you stay here and the canoe guys who rowed on the water safari made you feel safe during the crossing. 
This hotel is the hidden gem in Polonnaruwa. But I guess it will not be a secret anymore and EKHO Lake resort will find themselves echoing around the world. The rating of this hotel when you google is 4 star but we felt our experience was a 5 star experience! A huge thank you to the staff for making our stay super amazing.
title: EKHOED around the world! This hotel will beâ€¦

ownerResponse:

Dear Guest,

roomTip:
Rent bikes, try massage at Kalundinis salon and go to the villages.

Beware of stray dogs in the night.
text: Seyara was aboslutely amazing. We stayed there for 8 nights, me, my kids (11+16) and friends with kids at the same age. All of us loved the place. The owner arranged bike rental and showed us several routes through paddy fields and villages. We swam in the canal, played football with the locals and saw plenty of animals. By far the best place I've stayed at.
title: Amazing staff, peaceful place

placeInfo: {'id': '3682523', 'name': 'Seyara Holiday Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 340, 'locationString': 'Polonnaruwa, North Central Province', 'latitude': 7.963073, 'longitude': 80.98703, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304140-d3682523-Reviews-Seyara_Holiday_Resort-Polonnaruwa_North_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.seyaraholiday.com', 'address': 'Bendiwewa, Polonnaruwa 51000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': 'Bendiwewa', 'city': 'Polonnaruwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '51000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 26, 'count4': 113, 'count5': 187}}
roomTip: Bring shampoo & body wash if you are staying in cheaper places in Sri Lanka. Almost everywhere we stayed had soap only.
text:
Another guest was checking out on our first morning at Seyara. She took us aside and said: "you're in for a real treat here, these people will take amazing care of you." The Australian lady wasn't wrong. Upali and his team were the most thoughtful hosts we came across in a country full of thoughtful and caring hospitality. The assistance they offered with seeing the sites was exactly that - helping us have a great time without a hint of upselling. We did spend a day with Upali's friend Sugash and his tuk-tuk and couldn't have been in better hands. Seyara's cooking staff are also wonderful. While a western breakfast was available, they also offered us a slightly different Sri Lankan breakfast each day of our stay (hoppers with a curry, plus halape/halapa, vadai etc) - it was delicious every time and something we found a bit hard to find at other hotels. Our room was comfortable and clean (and included a mosquito net but no products other than soap). All up, this hotel is incredible value.  

*We were also lucky enough to see Malabar pied hornbills sitting on the trees besides the pool - I thought they were toucans, but have now learned I was wrong.
title: Amazing hospitality.

text: We had a wonderful stay at Sudu Araliya Hotel in Polonnaruwa! The location was perfect for exploring the ancient city, with beautiful views of the Parakrama Samudraya. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and well-equipped, offering a great respite after a day of sightseeing. The staff was exceptionally welcoming and helpful, always ready to assist with a smile. Dining at the hotel was a delight, featuring a variety of both local and international dishes that were absolutely delicious. We especially enjoyed the serene ambiance of the hotel grounds, which made our stay relaxing and rejuvenating. Highly recommend Sudu Araliya Hotel for anyone visiting Polonnaruwa!
title: Perfect Stay at Sudu Araliya: Comfort, Cuisine, and Courtesy in Polonnaruwa

placeInfo: {'id': '594619', 'name': 'Giritale Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 480, 'locationString': 'Giritale, Polonnaruwa, North Central Province', 'latitude': 7.989361, 'longitude': 80.922905, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1189034-d594619-Reviews-Giritale_Hotel-Giritale_Polonnaruwa_North_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.giritalehotel.com/', 'address': 'Elahera - Giritale Road, Giritale, Polonnaruwa 51026 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Elahera - Giritale Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Giritale', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '51026'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 17, 'count2': 25, 'count3': 118, 'count4': 202, 'count5': 118}}
roomTip: Try to double check the booking. They might cancel if they got high demand.
text:
We had booked two rooms at the Girithale Hotel for the 14th of September through Booking.com, about two weeks ago. On the 12th, we received an email stating that, due to an issue with the hotel, our booking had been canceled. However, upon further checking, we discovered that the same rooms had been allocated to different guests.

This reflects very poor management, and the hotel showed a lack of consideration for guests. As a result, we struggled to find alternative accommodation. The hotel then attempted to offer us a single room for four people, which was clearly unrealistic, but we reluctantly agreed given the last-minute nature of the situation. Unfortunately, they informed us later that even this room was no longer available.

This experience was highly unprofessional, and I would advise caution when considering this hotel in the future.
title: Unprofessional Management and Poor Service at Girithale Hotel

placeInfo: {'id': '594619', 'name': 'Giritale Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 480, 'locationString': 'Giritale, Polonnaruwa, North Central Province', 'latitude': 7.989361, 'longitude': 80.922905, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g1189034-d594619-Reviews-Giritale_Hotel-Giritale_Polonnaruwa_North_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.giritalehotel.com/', 'address': 'Elahera - Giritale Road, Giritale, Polonnaruwa 51026 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Elahera - Giritale Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Giritale', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '51026'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 17, 'count2': 25, 'count3': 118, 'count4': 202, 'count5': 118}}
text:
My stay at Hotel Giritale was truly outstanding, and I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a relaxing getaway. From the moment I booked my stay, the service was impeccable.

Special thanks to Mr. Ganesh, whose personal attention and care from booking to checkout made all the difference. His dedication to ensuring every guest has a memorable experience is clearly reflected in the hotelâ€™s operations.

The staff was incredibly warm and attentive, always eager to assist with a smile. Their service added a personal touch that made my stay even more enjoyable.

The food at the hotel was another highlight. Every meal was a delight, offering a wide variety of delicious options that catered to all tastes. Whether it was breakfast, lunch, or dinner, the flavors were consistently excellent.

The lake view rooms are a true gem of this hotel. Waking up to the tranquil view of the lake each morning was nothing short of magical. The rooms were spacious, clean, and well-furnished, offering a perfect blend of comfort and elegance.
title: Hotel Giritale exceeded my expectations!
